title: 3 bed detached bungalow for sale Grange Avenue, Cheadle Hulme, Stockport SK8
description: Fully renovated & extended detached bungalow in sought-after Cheadle Hulme. Close to Laurus Cheadle Hulme High & Primary schools. Stylish living room with dual-aspect windows & bespoke media wall. Stunning open-plan kitchen/dining space with island & folding patio doors. Additional snug/lounge plus second fully equipped kitchen. Luxurious master suite with dressing area & sleek en-suite. Fully enclosed lawned garden with deck, patio, summer house & storage. Large in-and-out driveway & no vendor chain. Situated in the heart of Cheadle Hulme, close to highly regarded schools including Laurus Cheadle Hulme High & Primary, this outstanding detached bungalow has been meticulously renovated and thoughtfully extended to create a luxurious, stylish, and practical home ideal for family life. Available with No Vendor Chain, it offers both elegance and convenience in equal measure. Description Set back from the road, the property boasts a large frontage with an impressive in-and-out driveway, leading to a welcoming front door and entrance hall that immediately sets the tone. To the front, a beautifully styled living room enjoys dual-aspect windows, bespoke fitted cabinetry, and a contemporary media wall with ambient lighting. The open-plan kitchen/dining area forms the true hub of the home - an extended space with a high-spec fitted kitchen, integral appliances, and matching island/breakfast bar. A sociable dining area sits beneath a statement lantern roof, with folding patio doors opening directly onto the composite deck - perfect for entertaining. A cosy snug/lounge area also benefits from a lantern roof, while a practical second kitchen is fully equipped with integrated appliances, oven, hob, and built-in microwave, providing extra versatility for busy family life. The luxurious master suite overlooks the rear garden and includes a separate dressing area/walk-in wardrobe plus a sleek, fully tiled en-suite shower room. Bedroom two offers extensive fitted wardrobes, while bedroom three is another generous double. These are served by a stylish, fully tiled family bathroom with both a separate bath and shower enclosure. Additional features include a large loft space - accessed via a drop-down ladder - with skylights providing natural light, making it a superb storage or hobby area. Externally, the rear garden is a true highlight: A vast, fully enclosed lawn with a composite deck, patio area, charming summer house, and a useful storage facility to the side. This home perfectly blends contemporary style with family-friendly practicality - a rare opportunity in one of Cheadle HulmeÂ¿s most sought-after locations. Directions SK8 5EN Location Cheadle offers a good selection of shops, pubs and restaurants and provides excellent educational facilities for children of all ages. Cheadle Royal Shopping Centre is close by together with access to the A34 by-pass which leads to Handforth Dean and Stanley Green Retail Park. Motorway connections to the M60 are available at both ends of the village, Manchester International Airport is easily accessible, whilst railway stations are situated at nearby Gatley and Cheadle Hulme. description: Quiet Cul-De-Sac Location Driveway Parking Traditional Semi Detached Large Wrap Around Rear Garden Two Spacious Double Bedrooms Well Presented Situated at the top of a quiet cul-de-sac, this well presented two-bedroom home effortlessly combines period charm with modern touches. The property benefits from driveway parking and is set in a peaceful location, making it an ideal retreat while still being conveniently located. Upon entering the home, you are welcomed by a bright hallway that showcases the original internal doors and staircase, giving a warm and characterful first impression. Under the stairs, a practical storage cupboard houses the boiler and is plumbed for a washing machine. To the front of the house is a cosy reception room featuring a charming wrought iron fireplace and a large bay window, flooding the space with natural light. To the rear of the property, a spacious open-plan room creates a wonderful space for modern living. This area incorporates a comfortable lounge with a wood burner, a dining area with French doors opening directly onto the garden, and a well-designed shaker-style kitchen complete with a range of fitted cupboards. Itâ€™s a perfect space for entertaining or enjoying family time, with a seamless flow between indoors and outdoors. Upstairs, the master bedroom is generously sized and positioned at the front of the house. With dual windows and a classic picture rail, itâ€™s a bright and elegant space. The second bedroom is also a large double, overlooking the rear garden. The bathroom is tastefully fitted with a large walk-in shower, WC, and a stylish vanity sink unit, offering a luxurious and contemporary feel. The rear garden is a true highlight of the property. Westerly facing, it enjoys the afternoon and evening sun, with steps leading down to a well-maintained lawn and colourful flower borders. To the side, a dedicated kitchen garden allows for the growing of a variety of vegetables, lovingly tended by the current owner. An unexpected and unique feature is the original Anderson shelter situated at the side of the property â€” a fascinating historical touch that adds further character. This home is full of charm, from its original features to its modern comforts, and is ideal for buyers looking for a quiet yet connected lifestyle in a welcoming and attractive setting. Entrance Hall The entrance hall greets you with a cosy and practical space featuring carpeted flooring and a staircase leading to the first floor. Lounge The lounge is a spacious, bright room with laminate flooring and a large window at the front that fills the space with natural light. There is a charming fireplace with a decorative surround, offering a warm focal point. At the rear, full-length glazed doors open onto the garden patio, creating a lovely flow between indoor and outdoor living. Kitchen The kitchen is thoughtfully arranged with a range of light wood-effect cabinets and black work surfaces. It includes an integrated oven with a extractor hood above, a sink positioned under the window looking out to the garden, and space for appliances such as a washing machine. Bedroom 1 Bedroom 1 is a generous double room, carpeted for comfort and featuring a large window at the front aspect. Bedroom 2 Bedroom 2 is a spacious double room located at the rear of the house. It is carpeted and benefits from a large window overlooking the garden, allowing for pleasant views and natural light. Bathroom The bathroom is neatly presented and includes a white suite comprising a bathtub with an overhead shower, a pedestal wash basin, and a close-coupled WC. The room is illuminated by a frosted window which provides privacy while allowing natural light to enter. Rear Garden The rear garden is a beautifully maintained outdoor space featuring a paved patio with wooden garden furniture perfect for dining or relaxing. The garden is well planted with mature shrubs and small trees, creating a tranquil, private atmosphere. A gate provides access to an additional garden area beyond, which is mainly laid to lawn with further planting, offering a versatile space to enjoy outdoor living. Front Exterior The front exterior showcases the property as a traditional semi-detached brick home with a driveway leading to the entrance. The front garden is laid mainly to lawn with a paved path and is bordered by low fencing, offering a welcoming and tidy approach to the property. description: Detached House Three Large Bedrooms Garage and Large Driveway For Parking Good Size Garden With Additional Garden Opposite Standish Village Offered With No Chain This well-presented home benefits from ownership of land directly across the road, along with a front garden and a driveway providing off-road parking for approximately three vehicles, a tandem garage plus a spacious rear garden. The property also benefits from being offered with no chain. Upon entering, you are greeted by a spacious entrance hallway which includes a modern shower room fitted with a shower cubicle, WC, and wash basin. There are also two under-stairs cupboards, ideal for coat and shoe storage. The L-shaped lounge/dining room is a generous living space, featuring three windows allowing in plenty of natural light and an electric fireplace creating a cosy focal point. The kitchen is well-equipped with a range of wall and base units, an electric hob and oven, and a door leading out to the rear garden. A third large double bedroom is situated on the ground floor, to the front and benefits from a light and airy aspect. Upstairs, the galleried landing leads to a family bathroom complete with a shower over the bath, WC, and sink. The master bedroom is a bright and spacious double, offering built-in wardrobes into the eaves. The second bedroom is also a good-sized double, with useful eaves storage. The rear garden is of a generous size, mainly laid to lawn with a paved path, offering a private and sunny outdoor space ideal for relaxing or entertaining. title: 4 bed detached house for sale Wakefield Road, Stalybridge, Greater Manchester SK15
description: Freehold - Council Tax Band E Character property built around 1836 High ceilings throughout Spacious lounge with fireplace & bay window Separate dining room Two bathrooms Attic & basement Stunning outdoor area with decked balcony Close to amenities Viewing advised Spacious and well-presented detached home offering four bedrooms with potential for a fifth in the attic, generous parking, and double glazing throughout. Situated in a desirable Stalybridge location close to schools, parks, local amenities, and exce Built around 1836, this remarkable four-bedroom detached home combines historical grandeur with modern comfort, offering generous proportions, elegant period features, and stunning panoramic views. From its elevated position, the property commands an impressive presence, with its stone facade, original detailing, and mature gardens behind wrought iron railings. Off-road parking is plentiful, ensuring convenience alongside kerb appeal. Step inside through a striking stained-glass doorway and into a large, welcoming hallway, where the scale and character of the home are immediately apparent. Two substantial reception rooms, each adorned with high ceilings, ornate cornicing, large bay windows, and polished wooden floors, provide both formal and informal living options. The main lounge features a beautiful fireplace, while the dining room offers ample space for entertaining. The country-style kitchen is well-appointed with wooden worktops, integrated appliances, and a charming breakfast bar, complemented by a useful utility room. Downstairs, a unique cellar bar creates a truly distinctive leisure space - perfect for hosting friends or enjoying a cosy evening in. Upstairs, there are four spacious double bedrooms, each with its own character. The principal bedroom boasts a period fireplace and plenty of natural light. A luxurious family bathroom offers both a walk-in shower and a separate bath, while a second bathroom retains a classic roll-top tub for added indulgence. The second floor reveals a vast games room - currently housing a full-sized snooker table - with the potential to be converted into a fifth bedroom, studio, or office. Situated within easy reach of excellent local schools, transport links to Manchester, Leeds, and beyond, scenic walking trails, parks, and a range of local shops, cafes, and restaurants, this is a rare opportunity to acquire a home that blends heritage, space, and lifestyle flexibility in one outstanding package. description: *** new instruction, must be viewed *** 6 bedrooms, 4 reception rooms and 5 bathrooms An outstanding, fully renovated family home Off road parking for multiple vehicles Beautifully landscaped rear garden Freehold Over 5,000 sq ft across four floors No onwards chain Easy access to motorway links and manchester city centre Period features found throughout Hunters are proud to present this exceptional six-bedroom detached substantial Victorian villa, believed to have been built circa 1860 by the Apsell Family, owners of the former Tonge Mill. The residence is perfectly positioned opposite Limefield Park on the sought-after Manchester Old Road and less than 3 minutes walk to Alkrington Woods Nature Reserve which offers over 120 acres of mature woodland, meadows, rivers and fishing lodges. Thoughtfully restored and redesigned by the current owners, the home exemplifies superior craftsmanship and attention to detail throughout. Offered with no chain and freehold tenure, this distinctive property seamlessly blends period features with high-quality modern upgrades and expansive, beautifully maintained grounds â€” an ideal home for large or growing families. Upon entering, a grand hallway with original flooring and high ceilings sets a welcoming tone. Two elegant front reception rooms, both bathed in natural light from large bay windows and side windows featuring original wooden shutters, offer ideal spaces for entertaining or relaxing. Continuing through the hallway, you'll find a spacious dining room with traditional wooden flooring, perfect for hosting large gatherings. The ground floor also boasts a well-equipped kitchen and breakfast area, complete with premium appliances, which connects to a separate, self-contained annex. This additional living space includes a second kitchen, bathroom, lounge and a double bedroom â€” ideal for extended family or guests. The annex is easily separated / combined into the main residence with two lockable internal doors. A stylish garden room at the rear of the property overlooks the garden, while a convenient downstairs WC completes the ground floor. Upstairs, the traditional landing leads to five large bedrooms. The standout master suite features a duplex design, with a spiral staircase leading to a private upper level that includes a lounge (with ideal work from home office space), bathroom featuring twin bathtubs, and separate shower room â€” perfect for modern living. A spacious family bathroom, a Jack & Jill shower room, and an en-suite to one of the bedrooms ensure convenience and comfort for all. For added versatility, the property includes a large basement divided into three rooms â€” offering excellent potential for conversion into games / entertainment spaces or an additional self-contained living space. Additionally, a separate log cabin, currently used as an exercise studio and office, benefits from a shower & WC, electricity and ethernet connections. Outside, the rear garden offers a private oasis, tastefully landscaped with a mix of lawn and decking, and includes a hot tub area. The front of the property features a large driveway providing ample off-road parking. Ideally located in a popular residential area, this home offers easy access to local amenities, well-regarded schools, motorway links, Heaton Park, and is just around 7 miles from Manchester City Centre. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the scale, charm, and outstanding potential of this unique family home. description: Four-Bedroom Semi-Detached Stone Farmhouse Idyllic Rural Setting Close To Edgworth Glass-Roofed Conservatory With Panoramic Views Award-Winning Lounge With Double-Sided Fireplace Character Dining Room With Exposed Oak Beams Contemporary Kitchen With Breakfast Bar Seating Main Bedroom With En-Suite Shower Room Luxury Family Bathroom With Rainfall Shower Landscaped Gardens With Multiple Seating Areas Integral Double Garage And Ample Driveway Parking For 6 Spacious 4-Bedroom Stone Farmhouse In A Idyllic Rural Edgworth Setting Birches Farm Cottage â€“ A Most Unique Setting Tucked just off Bury Road, close to the picturesque village of Edgworth, Birches Farm Cottage is a honey-hued semi-detached stone farmhouse where timeless character meets modern living. Framed by open countryside, its glass-roofed conservatory captures sweeping views across rolling fields, while the gardens â€“ a blend of manicured lawns, vibrant borders, and stone pathways â€“ offer peaceful corners to pause and take in the surroundings. The approach sets the scene. A gentle climb along a farm track, edged with open green fields and drystone walls, draws you deeper into rural life. Passing through the working farmyard, the air carries the scent of hay and the occasional sound of livestock, a reminder of the homeâ€™s agricultural setting. Beyond the old stone gateposts and cattle grid, the paved driveway and integral double garage mark your arrival at this welcoming home. Where Character Meets Comfort Step inside the covered portico entrance into a bright, contemporary hallway, complete with a handy cloakroom cupboard and direct access to the garage. The warmth of the timber front door, the herringbone flooring, and the overall light and airy feel immediately set the tone â€“ this is a home that respects its heritage while embracing a stylish, modern finish. A Lounge for All Seasons To the left lies the award-winning, magazine-featured lounge â€“ a showpiece of style and comfort. A rustic double-sided stone fireplace with wood-burning stove anchors one wall, adding warmth and character. Soft recessed lighting casts a gentle glow over white walls, oak doors, and the stone-flagged floor that flows throughout the ground floor. Generous picture windows frame the surrounding greenery, creating a connection with the outdoors, while the spacious layout offers the flexibility for cosy evenings or larger gatherings. Integrated ceiling speakers in both the lounge and the kitchen enhance everyday living and entertaining, offering seamless, high-quality audio throughout the social heart of the home Dining with a Sense of Occasion The dining room is full of character, with flagstone flooring under centuries-old oak beams. The double-sided fireplace forms a striking focal point, perfect for lingering over candlelit dinners. A wide picture window overlooks the garden, bringing the changing seasons into every mealtime. Above, the double-height section reveals the oak staircase, complete with cleverly integrated storage beneath, linking the two floors with light and openness. The Heart of the Home â€“ Kitchen & Conservatory The kitchen/breakfast room is designed to be both functional and inviting. Soft grey cabinetry with brushed brass handles pairs with warm wood worktops, while a range-style cooker sits beneath a concealed extractor, framed by rustic herringbone tiling. Integrated appliances include an oven, microwave, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, wine cooler, and a farmhouse-style sink perfectly placed beneath a window to take in the countryside views. A breakfast bar seating four creates the ideal spot for casual dining, morning coffee, or catching up with friends. From here, a door opens to the conservatory â€“ a light-filled space with glass walls and a vaulted roof that blurs the boundary between indoors and out. In summer, itâ€™s bathed in sunshine with garden scents drifting in; in winter, the underfloor heating beneath the tiled floor keeps it warm and inviting, making it a peaceful place to watch frost settle over the fields. French doors lead directly onto the terrace. A useful downstairs WC is located off the kitchen lobby. The garage, also accommodates the washing machine and serves as a practical laundry area, keeping day-to-day chores neatly out of sight. Upstairs â€“ Four Bedrooms and Countryside Calm The oak staircase leads to a vaulted landing filled with light from Velux windows, creating an airy welcome to the upper floor. Bedroom One â€“ The main bedroom enjoys far-reaching views from four windows, fitted wardrobes, and a feature oak-slat wall detail. The en-suite includes a double shower with glazed screen, vanity sink with mirror, WC, and marble-effect tiling to walls and floor. Bedroom Two â€“ A spacious double with a front-facing outlook, blue panelled feature wall, and built-in wardrobes. Bedroom Three â€“ Overlooking the side garden, decorated in soft pink to half height with a charming exposed beam behind the bed. Bedroom Four â€“ Currently a nursery, with a sage-painted feature wall and a view over the front. A Bathroom Designed for Comfort and Style The family bathroom combines practicality with a sense of luxury. Large marble-effect tiles flow from floor to ceiling, reflecting light beautifully. A wall-hung toilet, contemporary vanity with warm wood countertop, and countertop basin with chrome mixer tap set the scene. An illuminated circular mirror adds soft ambience, complemented by recessed shelving. The bath, with rainfall shower over, invites both quick refreshes and long, indulgent soaks. A chrome heated towel rail and thoughtful design touches complete the space. Gardens and Outlook The gardens are a perfect marriage of open space, mature planting, and uninterrupted views. Lawns sweep around the property, bordered by established shrubs, seasonal flowers, and well-tended beds. A paved terrace alongside the conservatory offers a sunny spot for morning coffee or evening drinks, while stone pathways link different seating areas. A raised planting bed adds colour and structure, and a firepit area provides a cosy place to gather. Climbing plants soften timber and stone boundaries, while hedges offer privacy without interrupting the expansive views. From every vantage point, the rolling hills stretch into the distance â€“ vibrant in summer, golden in autumn, and softly frosted in winter. In the Village Edgworth offers a thriving community with everyday essentials and a welcoming atmosphere. Within walking distance, youâ€™ll find a post office, village shop, butcher, two cafes, a hairdresser, and a beautician. The village also boasts a cricket club, 4G football pitches, and the much-loved Holdenâ€™s & Co ice cream shop. For dining, try the new gastropub at The Spread Eagle or the traditional charm of The White Horse and The Black Bull. Nearby Ramsbottom offers an even wider choice of restaurants and bars, just 10 minutes away. Edgworth Primary School is rated â€˜Goodâ€™ by Ofsted, with secondary options at Turton School and Canon Slade, both also rated â€˜Goodâ€™. Buses also run to Bury Grammar and Bolton independent schools. For outdoor pursuits, the scenic Wayoh and Entwistle reservoirs are close by, along with the village park. Commuters benefit from excellent road links, with the M65 just 15 minutes away, and Bolton or Bury reachable in around 20 minutes. Important Notice for Buyers We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only â€” they may not be exact or tested. Fixtures & Fittings Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller. Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. Weâ€™ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage. At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. Thereâ€™s a small, non-refundable fee of Â£25 per person (or Â£50 if youâ€™re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when youâ€™re ready to proceed. Please note, we canâ€™t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete â€” so the sooner theyâ€™re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home. Relationship Disclosure In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If thatâ€™s ever the case, weâ€™ll always let you know. Referral Fees We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need â€” such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. description: Tucked away on a quiet cul-de-sac in the sought-after village of Egerton, this deceptively spacious three-storey semi offers far more living space than your average semi-detached home. Recently upgraded with a brand-new kitchen and new roof in 2024, it combines modern comfort with stunning panoramic views over open countryside. Perfectly suited for family life, the layout includes a welcoming entrance hall, full-depth living room, spacious open-plan kitchen/dining room, home office, conservatory/utility, three bedrooms, and a family bathroom. Outside, the garage and under-garage basement provide exceptional storage, while the south-westerly garden captures the sun all afternoon through to spectacular sunsets. Living Space Step inside to a generous entrance hall with plenty of space for coats, shoes, and everyday essentials, keeping the rest of the home clutter-free. On the upper ground floor, the full-length living room offers a rare sense of scale, with large windows at both ends filling the room with natural light. From the rear, the window perfectly frames those breathtaking countryside views. The space is styled with a contemporary finish, complemented by a traditional chimney breast, oak mantel, and decorative inlet for added charm. Also on this level, a dedicated home office/study provides a quiet corner to work or focus, away from the busier heart of the home. On the lower ground floor, the impressive open-plan kitchen and dining room is the social hub, complete with underfloor heating for year-round comfort. The kitchenâ€™s timeless yet modern design features integrated appliances, including a double oven, microwave, fridge-freezer, dishwasher, and a four-ring hob with concealed extractor. The breakfast bar seats four, while the spacious dining area is perfect for family meals and entertaining guests. The room flows into the conservatory/utility, leading directly out to the garden for easy indoor-outdoor living. Bedrooms & Bathroom Upstairs, three well-proportioned bedrooms make the most of the homeâ€™s elevated position, with the rear bedrooms enjoying those same incredible scenic views. The family bathroom offers a blank canvas for a modern update to your own taste and style. Outside Space To the front, a private drive and garage provide easy parking, with the garage basement adding valuable extra storage. The rear garden is a great highlight, south-westerly facing to catch the sun from midday until evening, with a raised decking area for relaxing, dining, and entertaining against the backdrop of breathtaking sunsets over Winter Hill. Below, the lawn offers space for children to play or for green-fingered owners to create their ideal garden retreat. Location Despite the peaceful, elevated setting, youâ€™re just moments from the heart of Egerton village and only a short drive to Bromley Cross. Both offer an excellent choice of pubs, restaurants, shops, and highly regarded schools and nurseries. For outdoor lovers, the surrounding countryside, reservoirs, and West Pennine Moors provide endless opportunities for walking, cycling, running, and sailing. Commuters benefit from quick access to the A666 for motorway connections, while Bromley Cross Train Station â€” around five minutesâ€™ drive â€” offers direct services into central Manchester. description: Double garage Three reception rooms Freehold Situated in A quiet cul-de-sac Not to be missed! Beautifully presented throughout 4 spacious bedrooms 3 modern bathrooms Cosy log burner fire Lovely garden space Could this B your next family home? Nestled in a quiet cul-de-sac of Brambling Drive, Westhoughton, this stunning detached family home is a true gem not to be missed. Offering an impressive layout, the property boasts three spacious reception rooms, providing ample space for both relaxation and entertaining. The heart of the home features a delightful log burner fire, perfect for cosy evenings with family and friends. With four well-appointed bedrooms, this residence caters to families of all sizes, ensuring everyone has their own personal space. The three modern bathrooms add to the convenience and comfort of this exceptional property, making morning routines a breeze. The peaceful surroundings of Westhoughton enhance the appeal of this home, offering a serene environment while still being conveniently located near local amenities and transport links. This property is ideal for those seeking a harmonious blend of comfort and style in a family-friendly neighbourhood. In summary, this remarkable home on Brambling Drive is perfect for those looking to settle in a quiet yet vibrant community. With its generous living spaces, modern conveniences, and charming features, it presents an excellent opportunity for family living. Do not hesitate to arrange a viewing and experience all that this wonderful property has to offer. Important note to purchasers: Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller. To conform with government Money Laundering Regulations 2019, we are required to confirm the identity of all prospective buyers. We use the services of a third party called credas. There is a nominal charge of Â£50 excluding VAT for this (per person). Entrance Hall The entrance hall welcomes you with a stylish herringbone wood-effect floor that flows seamlessly through the ground floor. The space is enhanced by modern lighting and a striking glass-panelled staircase with wooden handrails, creating a bright and open feel that leads to the upper floor. Lounge (5.14m x 3.59m) This spacious lounge boasts a wood-effect herringbone floor and a feature fireplace with a rustic wooden beam mantle and a wood-burning stove, set against a deep blue accent wall. The room is filled with natural light from a large window, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere perfect for relaxing or entertaining. Kitchen And Breakfast Area The kitchen features modern dark gloss cabinetry with integrated appliances including an oven and microwave, complemented by a gas hob and stainless steel extractor. The tiled floor and splashbacks add a practical touch, while the large window above the sink floods the space with natural light. An adjoining breakfast area provides a cosy nook with space for casual dining, enhanced by patterned wallpaper and a comfortable armchair. The kitchen opens through an archway to the dining room, creating a smooth flow between the spaces. Dining Room (2.8m x 3.14m) The dining room connects directly to the kitchen breakfast area and features a simple, fresh design with light flooring and neutral walls. Double doors open out into the garden, creating an inviting space for formal or casual meals while enjoying views of the outdoor area. Utility Room (1.49m x 2.33m) A practical utility room is fitted with ample cupboard space, a washing machine, and a dryer. It has a tiled floor with a bold patterned design and a door leading directly outside, providing convenience and additional storage options. Study (2.60m x 2.33m) The ground floor study is a well-sized workspace with a tiled floor that has a rustic, stone-effect design and neutral-toned walls. It offers a peaceful environment for work or study, with an external door providing additional access. Bathroom (2.97m x 2.38m) The family bathroom combines a vintage-inspired tiled design with modern fittings. It features a bathtub with a tiled surround, a separate walk-in shower with glass doors, a grey vanity unit with a marble-effect countertop, and a matching toilet. The floor is tiled in a complementary geometric pattern, and the room is brightened by a window with natural light. Wc (0.72x2.27m) The ground floor cloakroom is fitted with a modern white basin set into a pink tiled vanity unit, with subtle gold trim. The walls are painted a soft grey and there is a matching black radiator, providing a stylish and functional space for guests. Bedroom 1 (3.80m x 4.57m) Bedroom 1 is a large main bedroom with a soft grey carpet and a comfortable upholstered bed. It benefits from three windows allowing plenty of natural light and includes fitted wardrobes and a chest of drawers for ample storage. There is an en-suite bathroom attached, offering a private shower room with a matching tiled finish consistent with the main bathroom, and modern fixtures. Bedroom 2 (4.43m x 3.20m) Bedroom 2 is a well-sized room with a soft carpet and a large window that fills the space with light. The walls are painted in a lilac tone, adding a touch of colour without overwhelming the room. Bedroom 3 (3.41m x 2.34m) Bedroom 3 is a comfortable single room with a soft grey carpet and light walls. A window allows natural light to brighten the space, making it suitable for a child or guest room. Bedroom 4 (2.98m x 2.39m) Bedroom 4 is another single room decorated in a soft pink tone with a grey carpet. It has a window to the outside and is furnished to suit a variety of uses, from a childâ€™s bedroom to a guest room or hobby space. Landing The first floor landing is a bright space connecting the four bedrooms and bathrooms. It is carpeted in a soft grey and painted in neutral tones, creating a calm transition between rooms. Rear Garden The rear garden is a large, private space with a well-maintained lawn bordered by mature shrubs and trees, providing excellent privacy. A paved patio area offers a perfect spot for outdoor dining or relaxing, and a charming stepping stone path adds character while connecting different garden areas. Front Exterior The front exterior of the property features a double garage with mint green doors and a brick-paved driveway with ample parking space. A lawned area beside the driveway is neatly edged with mature hedging, providing a welcoming and private frontage. The heart of the home is the stunning open-plan kitchen, dining, and family room, expertly designed with high-quality fittings and striking bi-fold doors that feature integrated blinds, opening directly onto the landscaped rear garden. Upstairs, the property comprises three spacious bedrooms and two pristine bathrooms, along with a fully usable loft room that adds further versatility. One of the property's most enticing features is the self-contained annex studio to the rear, offering a private bedroom and modern shower room?ideal for guests or older children. Externally, the beautifully landscaped rear garden offers a tranquil retreat with ample space for outdoor dining and family enjoyment. Planning permission has already been approved for further extension, offering exciting potential for future development. EPC rated C, the home ensures efficiency alongside elegance. Patch Croft Road enjoys a prime location in Peel Hall, placing it within easy reach of a wide array of amenities. Local supermarkets including Tesco and Aldi are just a few minutes' drive, while several highly regarded primary and secondary schools are within walking distance. Residents also benefit from excellent leisure facilities nearby, including gyms, parks, and sports clubs. Wythenshawe Hospital is less than 10 minutes away, and the property boasts superb transport links, with easy access to Manchester Airport (approximately 4 miles away), as well as train connections via nearby Heald Green and Manchester Piccadilly stations. Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the space, finish, and potential of this outstanding family home. Combining location, flexibility, and quality throughout, Patch Croft Road is a property not to be missed. description: A stylishly presented and particularly spacious Victorian Semi-Detached family home 1735 square feet Ideally located within a few minutes walk of the Metrolink at Park Road Walking distance to excellent schools, local shops as well as being close to both Timperley Village and Altrincham Town Centre Two Reception Rooms Breakfast Kitchen, Utility and WC Four Double Bedrooms Two Bath/Shower Rooms Driveway Parking and low maintanence Garden No Chain! A stylishly presented and superbly proportioned victorian semi detached family home, located in this popular neighbourhood within walking distance of excellent schools, local shops, the metrolink and timperley and altrincham centres. 1735 sqft. Hall. Lounge. Family Room. Dining Kitchen. Utility. WC. Four Double Bedrooms. Two Bath/Shower Rooms. Driveway. Garden. No Chain! An attractive and particularly spacious Victorian Semi-Detached family home, in a quiet cul-de-sac and ideally located within a few minutes walk of the Metrolink at Park Road and walking distance to excellent schools, local shops as well as being close to both Timperley Village and Altrincham Town Centre. The stylishly presented property is arranged over Three Floors with accommodation extending to some 1735 square feet providing a Hall, Lounge, Family Room, Dining Kitchen, Utility and WC to the Ground Floor and there are Four Double Bedrooms served by Two Bath/Shower Rooms over the Two Upper Floors. Externally, there is a Driveway providing off street Parking and to the rear a good sized, low maintenance Garden with patio and Garden areas. This property is offered for sale with no chain and could be moved into with the minimum of fuss. Comprising: Recessed Porch. Panelled door with stained and leaded glass feature. Entrance Hall with spindle balustrade staircase rising to the First Floor. Doors provide access to the Ground Floor Living Accommodation. Stripped and stained floorboards. Dado rail surround. Coved ceiling. Decorative radiator cover. Lounge with sash windows to the front and side elevations. Impressive cast iron fireplace feature to the chimney breast with tiled hearth. Picture rail surround. Coved ceiling. Family Room with sash window to the rear elevation enjoying views over the gardens. Impressive cast iron fireplace feature with tiled insert and hearth. Built in cupboards and display shelving to either side of the chimney breast recess. Coved ceiling. Stripped and stained floorboards. Dining Kitchen fitted with an extensive range of base and eye level units, incorporating a breakfast bar, with granite worktops over, inset into which is a stainless steel one and a half bowl sink and drainer unit with mixer tap over. Freestanding Range cooker. Integrated fridge, freezer and dishwasher. Two windows to the side elevation and French doors provide access to the same. Utility Room with built in worktops and there is space and plumbing for a washing machine and tumble dryer. Wall mounted gas central heating boiler. Tiled floor. French doors overlook and provide access to the gardens to the rear. Ground Floor WC fitted with a modern white suite and chrome fittings, providing a wash hand basin and WC. Panelled wall feature. Tiled floor. Opaque window to the side elevation. Built in storage cupboard with shelves. To the First Floor Landing there is access to Three Double Bedrooms and a Family Bathroom. A staircase rises to the Second Floor Landing. Principal Bedroom One is a superbly sized room with three windows to the front elevation. Bult in wardrobes provide excellent hanging and storage space. Bedroom Two with reproduction sash window to the rear elevation enjoying views over the gardens. Built in wardrobes provide excellent hanging and storage space. Picture rail surround. Coved ceiling. Bedroom Three with sash windows to the side and rear elevations enjoying views over the gardens to the rear. Built in wardrobes provide excellent hanging and storage space. The Bedrooms are served by a Family Bathroom fitted with a modern white suite and chrome fittings, providing a freestanding double ended bath, separate enclosed shower cubicle with thermostatic shower, dual attachments and glazed door, wash hand basin and WC. Tiling to the walls and floor. Opaque sash window to the side elevation. Second Floor Landing with inset Velux window and access to Bedroom Four. Dado rail surround. Bedroom Four with attractive sloping ceilings with inset Velux window to the front and a window to the rear enjoying views over the gardens. Stripped and stained floorboards. Access to roof void storage. This Bedrooms enjoys an En Suite Shower Room fitted with a modern white suite and chrome fittings, providing an enclosed shower cubicle with thermostatic shower and glazed sliding doors, wash hand basin and WC. Inset Velux window. Stripped and stained floorboards. Externally, there is a paved Driveway providing off road parking and a stocked Garden frontage. To the rear, there is a paved patio area adjacent to the back of the house, accessed via the doors from the Dining Kitchen and Utility Room. description: Viewing Advised Presenting an immaculate three-bedroom terraced house for sale, ideal for first time buyers, investors, and families alike. Situated within close distance to public transport links, highly regarded schools, and a variety of local amenities, this property offers both convenience and a comfortable lifestyle. Upon entering, you are greeted by a spacious, separate reception room that benefits from large windows, allowing for an abundance of natural light to fill the space and creating a welcoming atmosphere for relaxation or entertaining. The recently renovated kitchen is thoughtfully designed, featuring ample natural light and generous dining space well-suited for family meals or casual gatherings. Each of the three bedrooms offers double accommodation, providing flexible options for families or those needing additional space. One of the double bedrooms benefits from direct access into the bathroom, which is styled as a contemporary wet room with a separate bath and is fully tiled for ease of maintenance and a modern finish. The property includes practical features such as driveway parking and a well-kept garden, perfect for outdoor activities or enjoying the fresh air. The large rear garden is definitely the highlight of this home! With a paved patio stepping down onto the large grass area, and another paved patio at the bottom end of the garden. This terraced home represents an excellent opportunity for a range of purchasers seeking a property that combines modern convenience with comfortable living. With its immaculate condition, generous bedroom sizes, and thoughtful design throughout, early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate all this superb home has to offer. title: 5 bed property for sale St. Barnabas Drive, Littleborough OL15
description: Five bedrooms Edwardian residence An elite style of presentation Four receptions Meticulous gardens Gated sweeping driveway Exquisite kitchen Laundry and Utility Three bathrooms Exceptional and large gardens A beautifully imposing Edwardian detached residence, magnificently set within its own grounds, and quite possibly being one of the finest homes within the area. The Old Vicarage is nicely nestled at the end of St Barnabas Drive with meticulously prepared gardens, gated sweeping driveway and a 'tip of the hat' to some amazing views of the local and surrounding countryside. This is undoubtedly a gorgeous family home, where perhaps anyone who has business in Manchester or indeed Leeds, can easily 'return home' to a place that sits within the countryside and yet boasts a positioning that enjoys a convenient connection to the highly desirable centre of Littleborough Village where boutique clothes and coffee shops await. The countryside is also quite literally on the doorstep making a quick escape into the hills very easy indeed, and if commuting is your thing, the train links from here are superb. This enigmatic dwelling has a style and an elite quality that seems to lavishly exude from everywhere and it is clearly evident that every detail from 'dÃ©cor' to 'flow' has been immensely and professionally considered. A brief insight into this exceptional and individual home further includes: Ground floor â€“ As you enter the property the large vestibule with original doors and ornate windows instantly welcomes you. There is a traditional cloaks room to the side. The reception hall has a returning stair case with a spindled balustrade to the first floor gallery style landing. The receptions are perfectly designed and decorated to enhance a function for each room as each one echoes its own personality. The study is already set for business as you will see. The sitting room is somewhere to put your feet up, and enjoy the roaring fire. The day lounge is again a place where the family may gather to catch up after the evening meal, still enjoying the sumptuous theme and with perhaps a more modern flair. From this lounge is access into the sun room with bi-folding doors, which is perfect if you are entertaining or is just the best place for an early morning coffee. The breakfast kitchen which is accessed from the hall and the sun room, is beautifully fitted with a breath taking selection of wall and base units, in-built appliances and matching Corian work surfaces. From here is access into the Utility and Laundry Room and personal access into the large double garage. Within here is a separate gym and a separate w.c. First floor â€“ the spacious and light galleried landing leads very nicely into each of the five double bedrooms and the two family bathrooms. As with the ground floor every detail has certainly been brushed with a professional eye. The Master Bedroom has been tastefully fitted with an exceptional level of quality furniture with a window seat to the bay. Bedroom number two enjoys its own en-suite bathroom and the house bathroom comprises of a luxury four piece suite. The guest bathroom is slightly smaller and still enjoys a sumptuous three piece suite. Externally â€“ at the front is the gravelled sweeping driveway with electronic security gated entrance. The gardens are meticulous and range from the traditional lawn with mature shrubbery borders, to a Zen style area. There is composite decking just from the garden room that currently leads to the large hot tub. Please note the property has solar panels and our client informs that there is a saving of approximately Â£2,500 per year. title: 3 bed terraced house for sale Delph Lodge, Huddersfield Road, Delph, Saddleworth OL3
description: Delph Substantial terraced cottage Approx 1,450 square feet Two receptions & three bedrooms Mature garden with fruit trees, bushes & herbs Off-road parking for three vehicles Close to local amenities Freehold Council tax band 'E' EPC: Tbc A deceptively spacious mid-terraced cottage set in an enviable position just a short walk to the sought-after village of Delph. An ideal family home, viewing comes highly recommended. EPC: Tbc. Set behind beautifully tended and substantial gardens, this charming home offers almost 1,500 square feet of accommodation, making it an ideal choice for family purchasers looking for additional space both internally and externally. Easily accessible from both the front & rear, where there is ample off road parking, personal viewing of the ground floor will reveal an entrance hall which opens into a multi-use room, previously used as a home office. A farmhouse style kitchen features a composite sink, range cooker and ample worktop space, and the large dining room features double doors leading out the well-stocked and mature garden. The large and welcoming lounge features mullion windows, exposed stone & brick fireplace and 'parquet' style wooden flooring, all helping to blend tradition into modern living. To the first floor viewers will find three bedrooms, all of which are good-sized double rooms, and a family bathroom comprising of a hand-wash basin and panelled bath with shower over. The WC is adjacent to bathroom, and a useful storage room containing the boiler and plumbed for a washing machine completes the accommodation. Benefitting from Smart heating controls, the property is warmed by an 'Ideal Logic+' combination boiler and well-maintained hardwood double glazed windows enhance the economy and comfort further. Externally to the rear there is off-road parking for up to three vehicles, two storage sheds and steps to an upper seating area with further shed and wood store. No public access across the property makes it private and pleasant enhancement. To the front, the mature and substantial enclosed garden benefits from both lawn and patio areas, including a multitude of shrubs and plants ensuring almost year-round colour. A growers paradise, the vegetable garden features a variety of plants, herbs and fruit trees, including gooseberry & blueberry bushes, apple & pear trees, rhubarb, strawberries and lemon balm. The owners have also been able to grow a wide variety of herbs and vegetables in the raised beds, including brassicas, pulses, garlic, onions and potatoes, whilst using a greenhouse to produce tomatoes, coriander and other herbs. Delph Lodge can be located just off Huddersfield Road on the fringes of the popular village of Delph in Saddleworth. With trendy pubs, cafÃ©s and wine bars within walking distance, the property is also ideal for easy access to neighbouring villages including Dobcross, Diggle and Uppermill and as such, this would prove an ideal choice. title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale Chichester Lane, Eccles M30
description: Located on the Desirable Bridgewater Development just a Short Walk to Monton Village Perfect First Time Buy Spacious Lounge Modern High Gloss Fitted Kitchen and Dining Space Three Bedrooms Three Piece Bathroom Suite and Guest W.C. Off Road Parking for Multiple Cars & Rear Garden Benefitting from the Sun all day Situated within Winton on the desirable Bridgewater development and overlooking the scenic Bridgewater Canal! This Fabulous three bedroom semi-detached property is perfect for both families and first time buyers alike. With a spacious lounge which seamlessly flows on through to the sleek high gloss finished kitchen and dining space, flooded with natural light beaming in through the French doors that open on to the rear garden. Completing the ground floor is the guest bathroom which adds convenience to any busy household. Head up to the first floor where you will find the three tastefully decorated bedrooms, two double alongside the generous single. Complementing the three rooms is the modern fitted three piece bathroom suite complete with shower over the tub. Externally this property offers off road parking for multiple cars, with gated access leading through to the sun drenched rear garden that boasts a well maintained lawn and paved patio. A stand out feature of this lovely home is its proximity to Monton village which is located just a short walk down the Bridgewater canal, whilst a five minute walk in the opposite direction leads you to Patricroft train station offering easy access to Manchester City Centre, Manchester airport and Liverpool. For families seeking a quality education for their children, the property falls perfectly within catchment for sought after schooling. The above are just a few aspects that make this property an excellent find, book your viewing and see first hand! EPC Rating: B Location Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus. title: 3 bed town house for sale Butterwick Fields, Horwich, Bolton BL6
description: Manchester commuter belt Around half a mile to train link Extensively modernised throughout Prime position opposite Star Lodge High quality thoughtful finish Dswc, en-suite plus family bathroom Two living areas Separate utility created to rear of garage Attractive landscaped garden Fantastic access to surrounding countryside This property has been extensively modernised in recent years and has been finished with flair and style. The accommodation offers great flexibility and by its original design is spread over three floors. To the ground floor there is a versatile living room/bedroom which opens to the garden. There is also a dswc and a utility zone has been created to the rear of the garage. To the first floor there is a bright L-shaped living area with three windows and an attractive dining kitchen to the rear. The first floor includes the regular bedroom spaces with two double bedrooms and one single bedroom all of which are served by the family bathroom whilst the master bedroom enjoys an ensuite. The bathrooms have been one of the more recent jobs and subsequently in line with popular modern choices of tiling and furniture. It is also worthy of note that during the last eight years items such as the boiler, windows soffits and facias and kitchen have been renewed. The properties in this specific part of the development opposite Star Lodge are seldom placed into the open market and an early viewing should be considered essential. The property is Leasehold for a term of 999 years from 1st January 2001 subject to the payment of a yearly Ground Rent of Â£100 Council Tax is Band D - Â£2,297.19 Butterwick Fields is a modern development located between Horwich and Blackrod and has excellent access to Blackrod train station which is on the mainline to Manchester. The modern development has achieved consistent rates of sale over the years and in particular this home, which is located close to Star Lodge is classed as one of the strongest positions within the development. For those not familiar with the town, Horwich has a small centre with a good variety of largely independently owned shops and services together with cafes, pubs and restaurants. A consistently strong feature of the town is the surrounding countryside which includes a stretch of the West Pennine moors and a number of reservoirs, whilst the nearby village of Adlington plays host to a stretch of the Leeds Liverpool canal. This balance of surrounding countryside yet convenient access to the aforementioned train station and also links to the M61 attract many people to settle within the area. The town offers several nurseries, primary and secondary schools. title: 2 bed semi-detached house for sale Parksway, Swinton, Manchester, Greater Manchester M27
description: Council Tax band B, Freehold Spacious living space Fitted kitchen Modern Bathroom Gated driveway parking plus large double garage Front and rear gardens with side access Requires modernisation/tlc but structurally sound Close to schools, shops, and local amenities Excellent transport links by road and rail nearby Viewing advised A spacious and extended two-bedroom semi-detached home in a popular residential area of Swinton, offering excellent potential for modernisation. Featuring a single-storey rear extension, generous driveway, double garage, and both front and rear garde Nestled within a well-established residential area of Swinton, this extended brick-built semi-detached property offers a fantastic opportunity for buyers seeking a home with scope to personalise. Set on a generous plot, it boasts a double driveway, double garage, and both front and rear gardens, making it an ideal choice for those looking for a home with space and potential. The property has been extended to the rear with a single-storey addition, creating a more spacious dining and reception area that complements the main living space. Internally, the home features two bedrooms, a family bathroom, and a bright main lounge. A new boiler was installed around two years ago, and while the home is fully functional and benefits from double glazing throughout, it would benefit from modernisation and general cosmetic attention to bring it up to date. The rear garden offers a private outdoor space with side access and plenty of room for planting or landscaping, while the double garage provides excellent additional parking or workshop potential. The surrounding area is popular with families and commuters alike. Several well-rated schools are located nearby, including Co-op Academy Swinton and St. Mary's rc Primary School, both within easy reach. For commuters, the property is ideally situated with access to the A580 East Lancashire Road and nearby Swinton railway station offering quick links into Manchester city centre. Regular bus services also operate along Chorley Road and surrounding routes. Local amenities include a range of shops, cafes, and supermarkets, as well as Swinton Square Shopping Centre. Residents also benefit from proximity to green spaces such as Victoria Park and Clifton Country Park, perfect for weekend walks, cycling, or time with family outdoors. With great transport links, schools, and a strong sense of community, this semi-detached property presents an ideal renovation project or long-term home in a desirable and well-connected location. Out side building is approximately 19 foot frontage by 18 foot depth, full electric with fuse box, was previously used as a childminder, recently used as a storage room. Suitable for other uses such as Gyms or office. The location is nothing short of superb. Chorlton is renowned for its electric mix of independent shops, eateries, and coffee houses, as well as its leafy green spaces such as Chorlton Water Park and Longford Park. Families will benefit from proximity to outstanding local schools, while professionals will appreciate the easy access to the Metrolink, Manchester city centre, Manchester Royal Infirmary, and Manchester Airport. Thanks to its size, layout, and location, this property lends itself not only to being a magnificent forever family home, but also presents an exciting opportunity for a medical practice, therapy centre, or nursing home â€“ subject to the relevant planning permissions. Homes of this scale and flexibility in such a prime location are rare to market. Donâ€™t miss the chance to secure this unique property with limitless potential in one of Manchesterâ€™s most loved communities. To book your viewing contact the Locate team at our Urmston office. description: Bedrooms to both ground and first floor Main bathroom to ground floor with en suite Modern kitchen to the rear Three reception rooms, one of which is currently fitted as an office Excellent modern presentation Generous rear garden Approximately 0.5 miles to fringe of retail park Around 1 mile to motorway and train links Long driveway allows for an abundance of parking Able to function as both a bungalow and a two-storey home A flexible layout and quality presentation are the key factors to this home which offers something a little different and should stand out from the crowd. There is one first floor bedroom with the further accommodation being positioned to the ground floor which includes three reception rooms, one of which is fitted as an office. A main family bathroom and two double bedrooms, one of which includes an ensuite. To the rear, there is a modern kitchen which opens to a large rear garden and the front includes a large, gated driveway with attractive landscaping. The sellers inform us that the property is Freehold subject to the payment of a perpetual yearly Rent Charge of Â£4.32 Council Tax is Band D - Â£2,297.19 A home, which is located in a particularly convenient position, allowing superb access to both motorway and train links. Both junction 6 of the M61 and Horwich Parkway train station are around 1 mile away. There is also excellent access to both primary and secondary schools. The area is equally ideal for access to nearby amenities which include a large retail development which is around half a mile away, whilst Horwich Centre is around 1.5 miles away. The area is conveniently placed for the excellent outdoor facilities the town has on offer. A simple satellite view of the location nicely illustrates this. Georges Lane for example which is a primary route towards Rivington Pike and the surrounding hills is around 1.5 miles away. A footpath leads from the top of Austins Lane itself into open fields. The town includes a nice variety of sports facilities including rackets and sports clubs, gyms and golf courses etc. In summary, the area has long been well regarded largely due to the excellent balance of access to amenities countryside and transport links alike and we would certainly recommend an early viewing. title: 2 bed semi-detached house for sale Beechwood Avenue, Stalybridge, Cheshire SK15
description: Council Tax Band A, Freehold Spacious Living Room With a Bay Window and a Fireplace Modern Fitted Kitchen/Diner Two Good Sized Bedrooms Smart Bathroom Enclosed Rear Garden Viewing Advised Stylish semi-detached home with character features, modern kitchen, two bedrooms, and a sleek bathroom. Ideally located near parks, schools, shops, and strong transport links. Move-in ready - perfect for first-time buyers or investors. Book your view This attractive semi-detached home offers stylish, ready-to-move-into accommodation across two well-planned levels. The property opens into a welcoming lounge featuring a bay window and tasteful flooring, perfect for everyday living. The modern fitted kitchen provides generous worktop space, integrated cooking facilities and contemporary units, with direct access to the rear. Upstairs, two well-proportioned bedrooms sit alongside a sleek bathroom with modern tiling and shower-over-bath, accessed via a central landing. Throughout the home, there are characterful design touches, such as exposed brickwork and wooden flooring, blending traditional charm with modern finishes. Outside, the rear garden offers a blend of patio and lawn, with leafy surroundings creating a private feel. Steps lead up to the front entrance, and there is further outdoor space that may be suitable for bin or bike storage. The property is located within a well-established residential neighbourhood offering easy access to local amenities and green open spaces. Stamford Park and the Peak Forest Canal are nearby, offering ideal settings for weekend walks, cycling or relaxing outdoors. The area is also a short distance from the scenic Tame Valley, with multiple parks and nature trails to explore. Families will benefit from nearby schools, including Stamford High School and Alder Community High, both of which are easily reached. Local primary schools are also within walking distance, and public transport links support access to additional education options further afield. For commuters, the area offers strong rail and road connectivity. Stalybridge and Mossley train stations provide frequent services to Manchester, Huddersfield and Leeds, while local bus services link surrounding villages and town centres. Junctions for the M60 and M67 motorways are within convenient reach for travel by car. A number of independent cafes, restaurants and local shops are within walking distance, with larger supermarkets and high street stores a short drive away. Tameside Hospital and key health services are also easily accessible. A brilliant opportunity for first-time buyers or buy-to-let investors alike. Early viewing is highly recommended to secure interest. Premium Fast Sale The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer. Benefits o Carefully implemented security measures o A speedy process o Realistically priced properties o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors) o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs o No risk of being "gazumped" o The full focus of our highly motivated team Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods. All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction. Deposit Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of Â£2,500. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost. This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss. An administration fee of Â£396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe. Exclusivity Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping. Process Our Premium Fast Sale Plus follows the below process: Step 1 - Register your interest Step 2 - Prepare your finances for the purchase Step 3 - Arrange a viewing Step 4 - Make an offer Step 5 - Secure your sale using our secure system Step 6 - Exchange and complete Don't miss out on the chance to purchase this property. Call us today for further information and to arrange a viewing. If you're interested in this property, we urge you to contact us immediately to arrange an early viewing and get the process started. This will help you to avoid missing out on this opportunity. Springbok Properties' innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. description: Prime Location â€“ Situated in a highly sought-after area close to top-rated schools, amenities, and excellent transport links. Spacious & Stylish â€“ Features a vaulted hallway, open-plan kitchen/dining room with Neff appliances, and flexible living spaces including four bedrooms. Luxurious Outdoor Space â€“ Landscaped front and rear gardens with modern stone features, raised patio, mature planting, and low-maintenance AstroTurf lawn. Ample Parking & Storage â€“ Generous driveway for multiple vehicles plus a garage with up-and-over door. Standing prominently in a highly sought-after residential enclave, this beautifully presented residence offers the perfect blend of contemporary design, generous living spaces, and thoughtful detailingâ€”making it an exceptional choice for the growing family. Ideally positioned close to outstanding schools, excellent local amenities, and superb transport links, this home truly has it all. Upon entry, you are welcomed by a striking vaulted hallway that sets the tone for the elegance found throughout. The spacious lounge provides a warm and inviting retreat, while the heart of the home is undoubtedly the impressive open-plan L-shaped kitchen/dining room. Fitted with a range of sleek modern units and high-spec integrated Neff appliances, this space flows effortlessly into a sitting area, which can be transformed to a true garden room via stunning bi-fold doors, perfect for family living and entertaining alike. Completing the ground floor is a versatile family room, a second bedroom with en suite, and a study or fourth bedroomâ€”ideal for home working or guest accommodation. To the first floor, you will find two further generously proportioned double bedrooms. The master suite features a stylish walk-in wardrobe, while the beautifully appointed family bathroom adds a touch of luxury. Externally, this property continues to impress. The expansive driveway provides ample off-road parking for multiple vehicles and leads to a garage with up-and-over door. The front garden is elegantly landscaped, boasting mature shrubbery and a striking modern stone feature that adds unique kerb appeal. To the rear, the private garden has been thoughtfully designed for both beauty and functionalityâ€”featuring a raised patio area perfect for alfresco dining, a section of premium AstroTurf for easy maintenance, and an abundance of carefully chosen plants and design elements. Internal inspection is highly recommended to fully appreciate the impeccable finish, refined layout, and exceptional quality this home has to offer. A true gem in a coveted location. Bathroom Has a rear facing double glazed window, radiator, ceiling light point and a three piece suite comprising bath, W.C. And sink. Front To the front of the property there is a garden. Rear To the rear of the property there is a yard area with outbuilding. title: 2 bed terraced house for sale Portree Close, Eccles M30
description: Fabulous First Time Buy Tucked away on a Quiet Cul De Sac within Winton Village Open Plan Layout to the Ground Floor Conservatory Offering Additional Living Space Two Double Bedrooms, One with Fitted Wardrobes Modern Three Piece Bathroom Suite Low Maintenance Garden to the Rear Allocated Parking Space Located Close to Excellent Amenities, Including Highly Sought after Schooling & Brilliant Transport Links Tucked away within a small cul de sac is this fabulous first time buy boasting open plan living to the ground floor and a conservatory offering additional living space. As you enter the house, you are greeted by the bright and airy open-plan layout of the ground floor, which creates a spacious and inviting atmosphere. The living area seamlessly flows into the conservatory, a versatile space that can be utilised to suit your lifestyle. Upstairs, you will find two double bedrooms, one of which features fitted wardrobes, offering ample storage solutions. Whilst the modern three-piece bathroom suite adds a touch of luxury to the property. The low-maintenance garden to the rear of the property is perfect for enjoying the outdoors without the hassle of extensive upkeep. Additionally, the allocated parking space ensures convenience and security for your vehicle. Situated in close proximity to excellent amenities, including highly sought-after schooling options and brilliant transport links, this property offers a convenient and comfortable lifestyle for its residents. Whether you need easy access to schools for your family or quick transportation options for your daily commute, this location has it all. Location Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus. title: 4 bed detached house for sale Malvern Close, Horwich, Bolton BL6
description: Fantastic access into open countryside Manchester commuter belt Both primary and secondary schools nearby Able to function as a bungalow and two storey house depending on preference Long driveway plus front and rear gardens Around half a mile into Horwich town centre Mainline train link around 1.5 miles Modern presentation throughout Three living areas Solar panels and air source heat pump included to reduce running costs A detached Freehold property which offers extremely flexible accommodation and is able to function as a bungalow or a regular two storey home depending on preferences. There are four bedrooms in total, two to the first floor and two to the ground floor with bathrooms at both ground and first floor level. There are three living areas, and the individual reception room is a particularly good size and plays host to a log burner. As you will see in the photographs, the presentation is of a modern style throughout with one of the most recent jobs being the bathroom which was replaced around four years ago. Please note that there is both solar panels and an air source heat pump installed during 2020 with the intention of being able to reduce running costs in the long-term The seller informs us that the property is Freehold Council Tax is Band C - Â£2,041.91 Malvern Close is positioned close to Pennine Road and consists of semi-detached and detached properties. The location provides an excellent balance of access to the consistently popular nearby countryside and also towards the transport links that serve the town so well. These links include access to the M61 and two train stations which are situated on the main line to Manchester. From a commercial aspect Horwich has a 'traditional' town centre with a good number of shops and services and there is also a large out of town retail and leisure complex close to the Toughsheet football stadium. The town includes several nurseries, primary school and secondary schools with education through to a-Level. All in all, we feel this package on offer is rather family friendly and will no doubt be of particular interest to those people who wish to spend time in and around the hills which form an impressive backdrop to the town. description: Eccleston Homes - Garrett Manor House style: The Hartford Spacious 4 bedroom detached Tenure: Freehold Offered with no onward chain Stylish and contemporary design Many local amenities Excellent transport links Easy access to the guided busway Early internal viewing recommended Millbrooke Estate Agents are thrilled to bring to market this beautiful, four double bedroom detached, Eccleston Homes - The Hartford. Built in circa 2019 and occupying a prime plot, with views of St John's Church to the rear. If you are looking for well well-presented, high specification property with an abundance of living space, then this is for you. The owners have finished the property to an excellent standard throughout with several upgrades such as Amtico lvt flooring, quality blinds and integrated Neff appliances. The tenure of the property is freehold, and it is offered with no onward chain! Comprising an entrance hall with under-stair storage, a single garage, a vast and bright kitchen/family room to the rear opening onto the low-maintenance, landscaped rear garden, a utility room, a guest W/C, and a dining room/second reception to the front elevation. To the first floor is a landing and airing cupboard, master bedroom with en-suite, second double bedroom, third double bedroom, a spacious fourth bedroom/study, and a contemporary three-piece family bathroom with a shower over the bath. Externally, the property has driveway parking to the front elevation for up to 2 cars + ample on-street parking. Side access and a stunning, low-maintenance east-facing landscaped rear garden. Ideally situated within walking distance of two excellent local primary schools. Excellent transport links with the newly constructed guided busway just a short walk away and within a short drive of the A580 East Lancashire Road and the M60 Ring Road. Many local amenities, including shops, bars, restaurants and the recently opened Parr Bridge Retail Park with various shops, cafes and a gymnasium. description: Perfect First Time Buy Located in the Heart of Monton Village Spacious Lounge Open Plan Fitted Kitchen and Formal Dining Space with Exposed Brick Fireplace Two Double Bedrooms Three Piece Bathroom Suite Gated, Low Maintenance Front & Rear Gardens Surrounded by a Plethora of Amenities Including Shops, Bars, Restaurants & Beautiful Scenic Walks Well Served by Public Transport and Motorway Links Opportunity to Create Your Perfect Home Welcoming to the market this brilliant terrace property located in the heart of Monton Village, offering the perfect opportunity for first-time buyers or downsizers to create their dream home. As you step inside, you are greeted by a spacious lounge, which leads through to the formal dining space thatâ€™s open plan with the fitted kitchen. The eye catching exposed brick fireplace creates a lovely centre piece and character to this brilliant property. Head up to the first floor the property comes complete with two double bedrooms, the master a lovely bright room positioned to the front of the house and the second, positioned to the rear comes complete with fitted storage. Complementing the two bedrooms is the three piece bathroom suite. This property boasts gated, low maintenance front and rear gardens, providing a private outdoor space to enjoy. Surrounded by a plethora of amenities, including shops, bars, restaurants, and beautiful scenic walks, residents will have everything they need right at their doorstep. For those who rely on public transport or need quick access to motorway links, this property is well served, ensuring ease of travel to key destinations. Whether commuting to work or exploring the surrounding areas, convenience is guaranteed. With the opportunity to create your perfect home, this property presents endless possibilities for customisation and personalisation. EPC Rating: D Location Monton village is a highly sought after, thriving village within close proximity of Manchester City Centre. With boutique and independent retailers dotted along Monton Road, Montonâ€™s range of shops give the area character â€“ you can find a specialist craft beer bottle shop, a jewellers and a home and lifestyle shop along the main shopping street, to name but a few. With an amazing range of coffee shops, bars and restaurants, Monton is a great place to go out to eat. Youâ€™ll find bars with heated terraces suitable for alfresco dining, wine and cocktail bars and venues that provide live music â€“ there is a real buzz around Monton! On the edge of Monton village is the Historic Bridgewater Canal, perfect for weekend walks. The picturesque Roe Green Loopline Heritage Trail is a convenient circular walk that begins and ends in Monton village, taking you along the canal towpath. Monton has schools of a consistently high standard, including Branwood Preparatory School and Monton Green Primary School which have consistently received Good Ofsted reports. Situated between the M602 and the A580 East Lancs Road, the village of Monton is only a 20 minute drive from Manchester city centre and a 10 minute drive from MediaCity. Monton village is serviced by rail services passing through the stations of Patricroft and Eccles, along the Manchester Victoria-Liverpool Lime Street railway line. From Patricroft Station it is only a 13 minute journey to Victoria, with around three trains an hour. Monton is also within walking distance of Eccles Metrolink Interchange, where you can travel across Greater Manchester.
