description: Luxurious Four Bedroom Detached Property Sitting On A Large Plot With Amazing Gardens Heavily Extended To Rear Offering Tons Of Space The Perfect Family Forever Home If you're looking for a wonderful family home with all the trimmings then please keep reading! Welcome to Bury & Rochdale Old Road, a sensational detached home set back from the main road occupying a secluded and incredibly private plot with beautiful gardens that will take your breath away! If you've been searching for your forever home that ticks every single box for modern family living then this will surely be of interest... Step inside to discover a substantial family property that flows with an elegant and crisp finish which is a true credit to the current owner. Simply un-pack your belongings and enjoy from day one. Benefitting for a substantial full-width extension to the rear, the house enjoys a stunning open plan kitchen/dining area which is perfect for those that entertain regularly. Furthermore there's a formal lounge, a separate study and four generous bedrooms. Open the bi-folding doors leading from the kitchen to reveal and enchanting rear garden which is a complete sun-trap in the warmer months and the perfect setting for a family barbeque. There's a separate patio area and a well kept lawned garden which is perfect for young children and is not overlooked in any way. The house sits on an enviable plot set back from Bury & Rochdale Old Road, Birtle between Bury and the village of Bamford. There's a great selection of amenities on the doorstep such as pubs, restaurants and leisure facilities. Those needing to commute and travel can access the motorway easily and for those that enjoy dog walking our outdoor pursuits, there's plenty of popular waking trails in the nearby countryside to keep you busy. In brief, the accommodation comprises; entrance door leading to a warm and welcoming hallway. A door to the right leads to a study which is perfect for those that work from home. Another door leads to a formal lounge area to the front which is nice and private. There's also access to a shower room on the ground floor. Another door from the hallway leads to a most spectacular open plan kitchen/dining area which incorporates a second reception room, a separate dining area and utility room. The kitchen is dominated by a central island unit and has plenty of integrated base and eye level fitted units. The kitchen has bi-folding doors leading to the garden. Take the stairs to the first floor and you'll find four generous bedrooms and a family bathroom suite. There's also a 'Jack & Jill' wardrobe which inter-connects bedrooms three and four. title: 4 bed detached house for sale Dryfield Lane, Rivington, Bolton BL6
description: Check out the notes from the planning consultant in the main description Open fields to front and side plus great views of The Pike 1.5 miles to train station Amazing potential 3.5 miles to motorway link Manchester commuter belt Under 1 mile to commercial centre The home is livable as is and offer scope to extend Open countryside on the doorstep High calibre location on the fringe of open countryside Notes from the planning consultant; dryfield cottage, rivington The plans that have been produced suggest a possible range of extensions to the existing cottage. These include single storey side and rear extensions aimed at providing proportionate additions to significantly enhance the overall floorspace of the dwelling. The site of Dryfield Cottage is located within the designated Green Belt, where development is very much restricted. As a consequence, the use of â€˜permitted developmentâ€™ (pd) does offer the potential for extensions and the like that otherwise may not be granted planning permission. These provisions (pd) have been influential with regard the plans which have been prepared. Consequently, the extensions are aimed at benefitting from â€˜permitted developmentâ€™ i.e. Elements of these proposals are unlikely to require planning permission. If the development was proposed, as suggested, or variations of such a development, then further discussion would be required as regards the position in respect planning legislation. It would be recommended that a â€˜Certificate of Lawfulnessâ€™ or â€˜Prior Approvalâ€™ from Chorley Council should be persued. Further advice can be given in this respect. The extensions, as proposed, are architect designed and seek to sympathetically extend the initial cottage in a contemporary way. The design has specific regard to the relative scale which would result between the existing and proposed, roof profiles, the proportion of the window openings and use of facing materials. The outbuilding proposes ancillary residential provision, including an ensuite bedroom, day/hobbies room and small gym. Alternative residential uses, which would be incidental to the main use of the site for the existing dwelling may well be acceptable. The site plan also includes off street parking. The proposals seek to take full advantage of the site and existing dwelling including maximising views across the site and to the wider landscape, sunlight, and daylight into rooms and maintaining privacy. Further information is available regarding the potential for development on the site can be provided. Agents description A fantastic and rare opportunity to purchase a detached home which is situated within a generous plot of around 0.224 of an acre and located in a very high calibre semi rural location with open fields to the side and rear plus a superb view of Rivington Pike and the surrounding hills. The property would no doubt suit those downsizing from a large home but wishing to retain large gardens and a high quality location. There is also great potential to work with the existing structure and gain planning permission to extend and thus create a house tailored to a buyers own style and specification. Equally, a buyer my consider wholesale redevelopment of the plot where the location can support selling figures in excess of Â£1M. The current layout includes a lounge and breakfast kitchen to the ground floor and two bedrooms plus bathroom and separate shower room to the first floor. Either the shower room or bathroom could easily be sacrificed to create an additional bedroom. We are advised that the property is Freehold and council tax band E The Area: Dryfield Lane is a highly regarded road in Rivington which is a village just on the outskirts of Horwich. The location blends a rural setting seamlessly with excellent access to facilities and an excellent transport links. The popular and independent Bolton School is around 5 miles away and Dryfield Lane is close to their bus route. Horwich town centre, which includes a good collection of largely independently owned shops and services is under one mile away whilst larger retail outlets can be found towards the Middlebrook development close to the football stadium which includes associated transport links (Horwich Parkway train station on the mainline to Manchester plus junction 6 of the M61). Blackrod train station is physically the closest rail link, is on the main line to Manchester and is around 1.5 miles away whilst the motorway junction is around 3 miles aware. Those busy working in Manchester city centre, for example, would no doubt relish their journey home to a rural retreat to enjoy the country park setting and enviable views. The area is synonymous with the philanthropist Lord Leverhulme who is understood to have socialised with the owners of properties in the area. description: An impressive, rural Hamlet style setting Accommodation of around 3700 sqft Great outdoor space approaching 1 acre Stunning far-reaching views Excellent provision for storage Huge master bedroom with vaulted ceiling Around 3.5 miles to train link Under 5 miles to M61 Substantial driveway, plus garage and outbuilding Fantastic, large cottage kitchen The Home: A large, detached stone dwelling nestled within the West Pennine Moors on the Smithills Estate and enjoying fantastic far-reaching views. Bumblebee Cottage is one of just four properties within the Hampsons Farm development which is a former working farm now converted to a residential, hamlet style setting. Being the only detached unit adds an additional level of prestige and the commanding plot adjoins open fields. The home was only constructed around 10 to 15 years ago, and therefore combines the rural setting and farm characteristics of stone walls under a slated roof with the benefits of modern construction methods and insulation qualities. The room proportions speak for themselves and there has been a great provision for storage within both the double garage and additional outbuilding. A large driveway caters for a mass of vehicles and also allows for the private storage of motorhomes/caravans etcâ€¦. Junction 5 of the M61 is approx 5 miles away and Lostock train station which is on the mainline to Manchester is approx. 3.5 miles away. The area in which the property is situated has recently been purchased by The Woodland Trust who are heavily investing with the restoration and ongoing care of the moors and woodland. title: 4 bed terraced house for sale Church Street, Horwich, Bolton BL6
description: Previously used for multi generation annex style living 2683 sqft Four double bedrooms Three reception areas plus large dining kitchen Stunning second floor room spanning the entire footprint Rare property type with potential for conversion A huge property offering fantastic value for money For Sale by Modern Auction â€“ T & câ€™s apply Subject to Reserve Price Buyers fees apply The Home: Offering a slice of local history and including substantial accommodation of 2683 sqft which provides immense flexibility, and will no doubt suit those buyers looking for a property offering something a little different. The double fronted accommodation not only enjoys substantial room proportions over three floors but includes a number of cellar rooms currently used for storage but offering potential for conversion, The home has previously been used for multi generation annex style living. The three reception areas to the ground floor connect one of which provides access to the substantial dining kitchen and there is also a rear hallway and large ground floor shower room. The three double bedrooms to the first floor have access to a family bathroom and there is also a flexible study and utility zone. This section of the property lends itself well to the creation of a huge master suite with the further bedrooms having access to the ground floor bathroom but also have proportions sufficient to take an ensuite if desired. A real factor can be found for the second floor which is a fully open space, spanning the entire footprint and includes stunning floorboards and exposed roof structure. This could be used in a number of different styles be its bedrooms, extended accommodation or an inspirational home office. Historically speaking 54 Church Street was built between 1803 and 1809 by the workers at the â€˜Wallsuches Bleach Worksâ€™, from the proceeds of a Terminating Building Society, hence the properties are known as Club Houses. Originally No.2 Chapel Street was a bakehouse. The cellar of No.54 was used for cotton handloom weaving and had external access up into Chapel Street. No.54 is the only three-storey house in the area: The attic would have been used as a warehouse for raw materials and finished goods. There once was an interconnecting door from the back bedroom into No.56 and all along the terrace. At the end of the 19th century, No.54 was a pub, the Three Horseshoes. During the early 20th century, the Horwich Town Band practised in the attic; access to the attic was via a fixed ladder and trapdoor from the back bedroom and there was still a partitioned servantsâ€™ bedroom in the sw corner with gas lighting. Previous owners converted the 2 houses from flats back into a single dwelling. Since 1988 the house has provided a ground-floor 'Granny Flatâ€™ and accommodation above for a family of five. The sellers inform us that the property is Freehold Council Tax Band D - Â£2,297.19 Auctioneers Comments: This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction, meaning the buyer and seller are to Complete within 56 days (the "Reservation Period"). Interested parties personal data will be shared with the Auctioneer (iamsold). If considering buying with a mortgage, inspect and consider the property carefully with your lender before bidding. A Buyer Information Pack is provided. The winning bidder will pay Â£349.00 including VAT for this pack which you must view before bidding. The buyer signs a Reservation Agreement and makes payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.5% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of Â£6,600.00 including VAT. This is paid to reserve the property to the buyer during the Reservation Period and is paid in addition to the purchase price. This is considered within calculations for Stamp Duty Land Tax. Services may be recommended by the Agent or Auctioneer in which they will receive payment from the service provider if the service is taken. Payment varies but will be no more than Â£450.00. These services are optional. The Area: Located opposite the Parish Church, Church Street is regarded as a high calibre part of the town. A key strength to homes within this area is their ability to provide access into the countryside which is possible to access just past the church. Footpaths lead into the hills that provide an impressive backdrop to the town. Whilst these rural links are so close to hand, the town also functions brilliantly as a commuter belt towards Manchester benefiting from access to several train stations linking to the city, together with junctions 5 and 6 of the M61. The commercial centre itself includes a pleasant range of mainly independently owned shops and services and within around half a mile of the subject property there is childcare at nursery level whilst the town has several primary and secondary schools. The nearby Chorley Old Road is a bus route linking Bolton to Chorley and commercial amenities are enhanced by the Middlebrook retail development which is close to the previously mentioned junction 5 motorway link. The retail park is around 1.5 miles away and includes a wealth of large outlets together with restaurants, cinema, gym etc. All in all, we feel that the area offers a family-friendly package. Cellar Rooms A number of cellar rooms essentially a mirror of un extended area of the ground floor and with good head height. Great storage and potential to convert. title: 5 bed detached house for sale Rosebank, Lostock, Bolton BL6
description: Cul-de-sac position just off Briksdal Way Four reception areas Five double bedrooms including large master suite Well-proportioned plot with potential for further extension Integral double garage Owned within the same family for over 36 years Bolton school 1.9 miles Ofsted-rated â€œoutstandingâ€ Lostock Primary School 0.3 miles Within the Manchester commuter belt Lostock train station 0.4 of a mile Situated within a prime residential area of Bolton, the five-bedroom No. 3 Rosebank was built in 1976, since when it has been considerably enlarged by the present owners during their 36 years occupancy. Rosebank is a tree-lined cul-de-sac of nine well-spaced properties. The South-facing No. 3 occupies a generous plot with mature well-tended gardens, of which that at the rear enjoys good privacy. The driveway at the front has parking for three/four cars, giving access to the integral double garage with its remote-controlled door. Heating throughout the house is provided by radiators, served by a gas-fired modern Viessmann condensing boiler installed new in May 2021. The main lounge also has a gas fire whilst there is a log burner installed in the living/reception room at the rear of the house. The front and rear extensions to the house were completed in 1996, providing the second living room at the rear, and - in addition to the already existing dining kitchen - a separate dining room accessed from the front entrance hallway. At the rear, a washroom/toilet and a storage room were also added. The plot on which 3 Rosebank is situated has ground space sufficient for further opportunities for enlargement and development, in addition to possibilities for upper floor enlargement, all subject to planning permission. Rosebank is 0.3 miles from the â€˜outstandingâ€™ rated Lostock primary school. It is well placed for easy access to the M61, and to Lostock mainline station with its links to Manchester, Preston and beyond. The private and highly regarded Bolton School and Clevelands school are within two miles distant. Middlebrook retail centre is within a two-mile radius. This region of Bolton is an exceptionally â€˜greenâ€™ and pleasant area. There are two golf courses within a radius of one mile, and four courses within two miles. Step inside to discover a sleek and contemporary design. Entering through a porch area leading to a bright and inviting lounge, and leading to a stylish high-gloss kitchen/diner, complete with integrated appliances, that are sure to inspire your culinary skills. A further sitting area and a ground-floor shower room are available to the rear of the property. As you ascend the stairs to the first floor you will find a vast master bedroom, a second double bedroom, and a third bedroom/study. Indulge in the luxury offered by the stylish four-piece bathroom, perfect for unwinding after a long day. The loft space has been boarded to offer additional storage with simple access via the pull-down ladder. The beautiful garden invites you to unwind amidst the soothing greens, while the decked area provides the perfect spot for al fresco dining or soaking up the sun. The addition of a gazebo offers a touch of sophistication and shelter, making it a versatile space for entertaining guests or enjoying quiet moments of solitude. Both of which are included in the sale. With driveway parking for two cars, and a wired/plumbed electric garage with storage cabinets, storing vehicles is a breeze, leaving ample room for outdoor activities or further expansion. This home is a commuter's dream, benefiting from excellent transport links by car and bus with nearby links to the M60 Ring Road, A580 East Lancashire Road, and beyond. Conveniently situated a short stroll away from a vibrant array of shops, bars, and restaurants. Other local amenities include the rhs Bridgewater Gardens, the Bridgewater Canal and nearby primary schools, this property presents the perfect blend of comfort and convenience. Don't miss the opportunity to make this home yours and experience the epitome of refined living in every detail. To the rear of the property is a beautiful, low maintenance garden with artificial lawn and covered patio seating area. This idyllic, listed property is set back from the road and has been sympathetically renovated externally, transformed into 17 contemporary and generously proportioned dwellings, 15 townhouses and two apartments, each having their own individual layout and bespoke features. The location is ideal for commuters with both the M60 Ring Road and the A580 East Lancashire Road just a couple of minutes from the property as well as excellent bus links. If you are searching for a unique property with that certain â€˜wowâ€™ factor this property will not disappoint! title: 5 bed detached house for sale Overshores Road, Entwistle, 0 BL7
description: Modern Luxury Detached Family Home Walking Distance To Entwistle Train Station Uninterupted Views Of Both Wayoh & Enstwstle Exceptionally Spacious Interior Layout Sleek Kitchen/Living/Diner Featuring Island Unit, Bi-Folding Doors & Woodburner Stove Five Spacious Double Bedrooms Main Bedroom with Lavish Ensuite, including Sauna and Dressing Room Five Bathrooms (Four Of Which Ensuite) Wrap Around Garden Surrounded By Rural Countryside Ample Driveway Parking for Several Cars Stunning 5-Bed Detached Home In Entwistle With Stunning Views Of Both Wayoh & Entwistle Reservoir Rural, but not remote, escape the hustle and bustle at The Marl, a home where traditional design and communal open plan living combine. Overlooking the reservoirs of Entwistle and Wayoh, and just momentsâ€™ walk from the train station, The Marl is a countryside oasis with connections to the wider world. Rural But Not Remote Nestled between the reservoirs of Entwistle and Wayoh and surrounded by fields and countryside, discover The Marl, a lovingly designed home bursting with warmth and character, tucked away at the end of Overshores Road, Turton. A private lane delivers you into the heart of the landscape, and to the gravel driveway of this rural haven, where estate fencing preserves the uninterrupted views of garden and countryside beyond. Once home to an 1800s cottage, The Marl, a handsome home designed to maximise the stunning views out over the fields and reservoirs, stands on this same plot, built in 2011 to offer a balance of traditional living for a modern era. Ample parking is available on the driveway, before making your way indoors, via the oak portico entrance and traditional-style front door. Traditional Home, For Modern Living Light streams into the broad and bright entrance hallway, through windows to either side of the front door. Underfoot, marble tiles gleam, amplifying the sense of light and space. Connecting to all the downstairs rooms, the entrance hall is a destination in itself, and also offers access to an understairs storage area. On hand for guests, a beautifully finished shower room can be found ahead from the front door, tiled in marble and furnished with walk-in shower, wall mounted wash basin and WC. Carpeted in cream, a traditional parlour style sitting room awaits on the right, awash with light courtesy of large windows to either side of the imposing stone fireplace, within which an impactful Chesneyâ€™s log-burning stove fills the room with warmth and welcome. Light-filled Living French doors invite further light in, opening to provide instant access out to the garden. A highlight of The Marl, you neednâ€™t leave the comfort of your seat to soak up the stunning views out over the fields and water. Double doors open up to the left of the entrance hall, where formal feasting can be enjoyed in the traditional dining room, a spacious room with a peaceful ambience, overlooking the drive via a bay window. Warmth emanates from the corner fireplace, furnished with a Stovax log burner. Also opening up on the left from the entrance hall is a second family sitting room, with a cosy corner stone fireplace housing an inset log burner, filling the room with cosy warmth. Marble tiling flows underfoot, making this the perfect family room, practical too for pets. With four, fantastically sized reception rooms available at The Marl, there is great flexibility to redefine the rooms to suit your own needs, substituting sitting or dining room for play room, cinema room or snug. Feast Your Eyes Ahead from the entrance hall and to the right, feast your eyes on the impressive Stuart Fraser Siematic kitchen. A host of integrated appliances include four Neff ovens (microwave, steam and two conventional), Neff dishwasher, Samsung American-style fridge-freezer and an induction hob within the central island breakfast bar, which also features an undermounted sink with Quooker instant boiling tap. Cleverly designed to wrap around the kitchen, the dining and lounge areas of this sociable and open plan family kitchen flow off from the central island, which also features breakfast bar seating, retaining a connection between the chef and the rest of the household. Family Time Overflowing with light and with incredible views out over the countryside, reservoirs and distant hills, big bifolding doors to three sides retain that constant connection to the outdoors. Accessed from both the kitchen and main sitting room, step out beneath the shelter of the covered patio and savour the views whilst dining alfresco. Marble flooring is practical and elegant underfoot, whilst the inset log-burning stove, with built-in log storage beneath, infuses the room with heat from the lounge area. The ultimate entertaining space, speakers connect to the Bose surround sound (connections are also available in the master bedroom and dining room) making this the perfect party room on special occasions. Owner quote: â€œI wanted the indoors to connect with the outdoors; you donâ€™t need to stand at the window to feel you are in the countryside.â€ Tucked off the kitchen, discover the handy utility, with further storage and plumbing for washer and dryer. There is direct access out to the garden from the utility room. Bedtime Beckons Ascend the carpeted stairs, with oak handrail, to the first-floor landing, a large, light-flooded space with access out to a glass fronted balcony, providing sunset vistas out over the Wayoh reservoir . On the left, make your way to bedroom three, the first of five, spacious, king-size bedrooms. Warm tones dress the walls in this welcoming room, with ample space for wardrobes and fantastic views down over the Entwistle reservoir. Guests can freshen up in their own private ensuite, where a band of glossy red tiling continues the warm motif from the bedroom. Furnished with a large, walk-in shower, with waterfall head and handheld attachment, there is also a wash basin and WC. Dressed in peaceful duck egg tones, bedroom four is infused with light from a large window looking out over the fields and valley towards Edgworth. Peaceful and serene, with ample space for wardrobes, wake up to glorious sunrises. Soak and Sleep Rejuvenate your senses in the large family bathroom, where a freestanding Whirlpool jacuzzi bath, with retractable showerhead attachment, invites you to soak away your aches and relax. Warm your towel on the chrome heated towel radiator and spritz your way into a new day beneath the rainfall spray of the separate walk-in shower, also featuring handheld showerhead attachment. There is also a wash basin and WC. Sneak a peek at bedroom five, with space for a double bed, this versatile bedroom, currently serving as a study, could be used as a nursery, with verdant views across the valley to the south. Sumptuously sized, bedroom two is dressed in a feature wall of forest green and has ample space for a king size bed alongside freestanding wardrobes and drawers. Relaxation awaits in the ensuite, served by corner shower unit, WC, wash basin and bath. Sanctuary awaits in the master suite, a celebration of space, sunlight and serenity. Windows and French doors invite light in from two aspects, framing views out over both the Entwistle and Wayoh reservoirs, and opening to a balcony. Overhead, the high ceiling, with lights recessed within the plasterwork, adds a reverent feel, spacious and airy, whilst cleverly positioned half walls lend structure to the space, creating a dressing room area and providing the perfect place for the king-size bed. Wake up to views out over the valley to the Wayoh reservoir ahead, whilst to the right, look down through a window onto the Entwistle reservoir. Freshen up in the private ensuite, with its own sauna, double jacuzzi bath, wash basin, separate shower and WC. Cocooned in Countryside Outside, the low maintenance lawns and Indian stone paved patios blend seamlessly with the surrounding countryside, separated by estate fencing, providing privacy whilst retaining the unbroken vistas that define life at The Marl. Perfect for entertaining, safe and secure for children, this is a home in constant connection with the outdoors. Owner quote: â€œItâ€™s very private, you feel when youâ€™re looking out as though you are master of all you survey â€“ the views are endless.â€ Along the gable side of the home runs a slated canopy, providing shelter and shade from the sun and retaining year-round use of the garden come rain or shine. Enjoy a glass of wine, a gin and tonic, or a lemonade whilst watching the sun travel around the home before setting at the front over the Entwistle reservoir. Near and Far Step out of the front door and discover the tracks and trails that take you into the heart of the countryside. Rural, yet not remote, you can lock the front door and wheel your suitcase just a few minutes along the lane and catch a train to Manchester Airport within the hour, before travelling on to any destination. Stroll the shores of nearby reservoirs of Turton, Entwistle and Wayoh, explore the local woodland and treat yourself to tasty refreshment at Holdens Ice Cream Parlour after first quenching your thirst at The Strawbury Duck. Explore the friendly village of Edgworth, where amenities include a local butchers, hairdressers and beauticians. You can pick up your essentials at the local newsagents and pick up a sandwich and coffee at the cafÃ©. There is also a Post Office. A spacious home, perfect for families, those with children can choose from a range of nearby schools including Edgworth Primary School and Turton Secondary School, with the renowned independent Bolton School also within commuter reach. Edgworth itself is a lively community, with events held regularly at the Barlow Institute and village hall. Alongside a number of pubs there is also a popular cricket club. An easily maintained home built to a distinguishably high standard, The Marl is a versatile home with so much to offer. With ample bedrooms and reception rooms for a young family, it would also suit those downsizing and in search of seclusion and solitude whilst still feeling connected. Owner quote: â€œThereâ€™s a sense of inner peace I always have when iâ€™m here.â€ A home that wraps itself around you, embrace the elements and discover the peace and tranquility of The Marl, a traditional home delivering modern living, that encourages you to slow down and be present in the moment. Leave the wider world behind (itâ€™s only a train ride away) and embrace the now, at The Marl. This desirable dwelling offers spacious living accommodation throughout and has a professionally converted attic bedroom. description: Sold by Modern Method of Auction Sought-after Hale Barns location Three bedroom semi-detached home Well-maintained rear garden with patio area and garden room Spacious driveway Excellent transport links No chain Positioned in a peaceful cul-de-sac, this superb three-bedroom semi-detached home offers well-balanced accommodation with a bright, modern feel throughout. Located in the desirable Hale Barns area, the property enjoys excellent access to local amenities, highly regarded schools, and convenient transport links to Altrincham, Manchester Airport, and the wider motorway network. The ground floor opens with a welcoming entrance hall leading into a spacious lounge and dining area, ideal for both everyday living and entertaining. The dining space provides direct access to the rear garden, while the adjacent fitted kitchen offers ample storage and a sleek finish. Off the kitchen is a practical utility room, and completing the ground floor is a useful downstairs WC. To the first floor, there are three generously sized bedrooms, all filled with natural light. A stylish family bathroom serves the accommodation, finished with modern tiling and quality fittings. Externally, the property benefits from a private driveway to the front, providing off-road parking. The rear garden is well maintained, with a lawn and patio area offering the perfect setting for outdoor dining, entertaining, or childrenâ€™s play. Combining a sought-after location with attractive, well-presented interiors, this property represents an excellent opportunity for buyers seeking a home ready to enjoy. This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer, or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability, and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.50% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of Â£6,600 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of Â£300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change. You may be recommended services by the Agent/iam-Sold. Recommended services are optional and the Agent or iam-Sold will receive payment from the provider where recommended services are taken. As such you should consider your options before accepting recommended services. Read full description In partnership with Zoopla insights Sign in and gain expert analysis to make informed decisions.

title: 5 bed detached house for sale Farrier Way, Appley Bridge, Wigan WN6
description: Impressive Detached Property Offering approx 3051 sq. Feet of Accommodaton Five Bedrooms Two Reception Rooms and Conservatory Open Plan Dining Kitchen Driveway and Double Garage Garden Room Currently being used as a Bar Viewing is Highly Recommended This detached home, located on this small and established cul de sac in the heart of Appley Bridge, is truly impressive, offering excellent space and a prime location. At approximately 3051 square feet it is certainly appealing for a large family. The layout which is not only well-designed, has also been much improved by the current clients throughout and additional features such as the bespoke garden bar certainly make this a home which is ready to move in to. Briefly comprising a welcoming entrance hallway which leads into the ground floor living areas. There is a handy ground floor cloakroom leading off the hallway and a spacious living room which leads into the additional conservatory and dedicated dining room. The open plan kitchen and dining area, flowing seamlessly into the garden, creates a fantastic space for family gatherings or entertaining guests. The kitchen is fitted with an excellent range of sleek modern cabinetry including an integrated dishwasher, pan drawers and a Neff oven, grill and plate warmer, add convenience and style. An additional island offers space for informal dining and French doors lead to the wrap around garden, perfect for entertaining. The laundry area is discreetly hidden behind the smart units at the end of the kitchen. Quartz worksurface complete the contemporary look. The first floor reveals four of the propertyâ€™s bedrooms with two enjoying the Jack and Jill en-suite shower room, which has been updated in line with the modern touches in this home whilst a separate family bathroom, also which has been updated, caters for the rest of the needs of the family. It is also worth noting that there is a lovely open plan landing area in this design of property which would make an ideal study or reading area, filled with light via a Velux roof light. The second floor reveals a further large bedroom fitted with an extensive range of wardrobes and a huge four piece bathroom suite completes this floor. There is also under eaves space perfect for hiding large storage. Externally, there is a tarmac driveway providing off road parking for a number of vehicles and leading to the attached garage. The garage is a pleasant surprise and has been recrafted into a very cool den/bar ideal for a teenage hangout however can easily be used as a garage if this is more of a requirement. The side and rear garden is mainly laid to lawn and has a decked patio area, ideal for outdoor dining. There is also a further handmade garden room. This would be perfect for anyone needing to work from home or to enjoy as it is currently used as a bar. It benefits from electrics and French doors leading to the garden. The proximity to the village of Appley Bridge, with its array of amenities, adds further appeal to the property, and the village enjoys itâ€™s own train station with direct links to both Southport and Manchester. The village offers canal side walks, â€˜Fairy Glenâ€™ and easy access to the motorway. Overall, this home offers a harmonious blend of space, functionality, and convenience, making it a highly desirable option for potential buyers seeking a comfortable and well-appointed residence. title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale The Mount, Hale Barns, Altrincham, Greater Manchester WA15
description: Sold by Modern Method of Auction Sought-after Hale Barns location Three bedroom semi-detached home Well-maintained rear garden with patio area and garden room Spacious driveway Excellent transport links No chain Positioned in a peaceful cul-de-sac, this superb three-bedroom semi-detached home offers well-balanced accommodation with a bright, modern feel throughout. Located in the desirable Hale Barns area, the property enjoys excellent access to local amenities, highly regarded schools, and convenient transport links to Altrincham, Manchester Airport, and the wider motorway network. The ground floor opens with a welcoming entrance hall leading into a spacious lounge and dining area, ideal for both everyday living and entertaining. The dining space provides direct access to the rear garden, while the adjacent fitted kitchen offers ample storage and a sleek finish. Off the kitchen is a practical utility room, and completing the ground floor is a useful downstairs WC. To the first floor, there are three generously sized bedrooms, all filled with natural light. A stylish family bathroom serves the accommodation, finished with modern tiling and quality fittings. Externally, the property benefits from a private driveway to the front, providing off-road parking. The rear garden is well maintained, with a lawn and patio area offering the perfect setting for outdoor dining, entertaining, or childrenâ€™s play. Combining a sought-after location with attractive, well-presented interiors, this property represents an excellent opportunity for buyers seeking a home ready to enjoy. This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer, or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability, and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.50% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of Â£6,600 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of Â£300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change. You may be recommended services by the Agent/iam-Sold. Recommended services are optional and the Agent or iam-Sold will receive payment from the provider where recommended services are taken. As such you should consider your options before accepting recommended services. Read full description In partnership with Zoopla insights Sign in and gain expert analysis to make informed decisions.

This imposing property comes with a price tag of 'offers in excess of Â£295,000', providing excellent value for money considering its stature and amiable specification. The house is superbly presented throughout, guaranteeing a ready-to-move-in condition that harmoniously blends elegance with comfort. This home is spread over two floors, with the entrance on the ground floor leading you into a welcoming porch. The ground floor boasts three well-proportioned reception rooms, including a spacious lounge, dining room, and breakfast area. Each room is smartly designed to ensure maximum use of natural light, providing a bright and airy feel across the house. Furthermore, the house features a good size conservatory and a modern kitchen fitted with high-quality appliances and ample storage space. The practicality of this home extends to a convenient downstairs WC, making it comfortable for your guests and daily life. On the first floor, the house consists of four generously proportioned bedrooms. These bedrooms exude a warm, homely feeling, perfect for relaxation and privacy. The master bedroom comes with an attached en-suite, providing an extra layer of convenience. A family bathroom is also available on this floor, elegantly designed with stylish fixtures and fittings. Equally impressive is the property's external areas. The front and rear gardens are immaculately manicured, offering a peaceful and private space to enjoy outdoor living. A spacious driveway offers ample parking space for multiple vehicles, further enhancing the practical allure of this property. The house holds a freehold tenure, adding to its appeal for those looking for a property for long term family living. To conclude, this fabulous house is indeed a family home that perfectly combines luxury, comfort, and practicality. Viewing is highly recommended to truly appreciate the exquisiteness of this magnificent property. Upon entering the property, you are greeted by an inviting entrance hallway that sets the tone for the rest of the house. The spacious lounge provides the perfect space for relaxation and entertainment, with plenty of natural light. The modern kitchen/dining area offers a stylish and functional space for cooking and dining and caters to the needs of modern-day living. A downstairs cloaks/W.C adds to the convenience of the property. Moving upstairs, you will find three good-sized bedrooms and a well proportioned white suite family bathroom completes the upper level of the house. The property boasts a laid to lawn garden to the rear with a patio area offering a perfect spot for outdoor meals or social gatherings. There is a double driveway to the front of the property, providing ample space for off-road parking. In addition to the property's many attributes, its location is a key selling point. Situated in a sought-after community area, residents will benefit from proximity to local sports and leisure facilities and pleasant dog walks. Overall, this three-bedroom semi-detached house offers a blend of style, comfort, and convenience in a desirable location. It presents an excellent opportunity for those seeking a modern and well-appointed home within a vibrant and welcoming community. EPC Rating: C Garden Garden to the rear with patio area. description: Fantastic Location Five minutes to Stalybridge train station Close to local walking routes and Dovestone reservoir Kingtons Estate Agents are pleased to offer to the market this spacious two bedroom terraced house located on the ever popular Mottram Road, Stalybridge. Situated in an ideal location for local transport routes, with Stalybridge train station just five minutes walk away and close to the motorway network. The local area offers a multitude of stunning rural walks, including the famous Dovestone Reservoir, Cheetham Park and Stamford Park. There are plenty of local restaurants and bars within walking distance, and local gyms and swimming pools just a couple of minutes walk. The historic area of Saddleworth with its museums, walks, cafes and restaurants are just 10 minutes drive away. title: 2 bed terraced house for sale Mosley Common Road, Worsley M28
description: Many local amenities Must be viewed to appreciate! Stunning and immaculate property Modern kitchen and bathroom Gas central heating and double glazing Tenure: Freehold Stylish and modern design Low maintenance landscaped garden Two good sized bedrooms Millbrooke Estate Agents are thrilled to offer for sale this stylish mid terraced property, that's ideally situated on the popular Mosley Common Road, Boothstown. Built around 1888, the tenure of the property is freehold. Offered in excellent condition throughout and boasting two bedrooms and two reception rooms plus a modern kitchen and a newly fitted bathroom suite. Just a short walk into the heart of the village with shops, bars, restaurants, and a community centre/library. You will also have two fantastic primary schools within a short walk and nearby access to the Bridgewater Canal. Excellent transport links by car and bus with the M60 Ring Road and the A580 East Lancashire Road both just a short distance away. The property benefits from gas central heating (combi boiler), upvc double glazing throughout, upgraded oak doors with designed fittings plus upgraded windows/door to the front elevation including Venetian shutters. Comprising a spacious lounge with a stove style electric fire, under-stair storage cupboard and a spacious dining room. The kitchen is located to the rear and finished with high gloss units, complementary surfaces, and an integral fridge/freezer. An enclosed stairway to the first floor and landing area leading to the large master bedroom. This stunning room includes fitted wardrobes and is a wealth of space. To the rear elevation is a second bedroom and a newly fitted three-piece bathroom suite. Externally the property is elevated from the road where you will have access to ample on street parking, a low maintenance front garden and a low maintenance landscaped rear garden with a patio area, decking and an artificial lawn. Gated access from the rear of the property to the alleyway. Internal viewing is highly recommended! description: Spacious 3-Bed Cottage Two Reception Rooms Original Fireplaces & Beams Modern Shaker Kitchen Four-Piece Bathroom Plus Downstairs WC Converted Loft Room With Views Over The Moors Cottage-Style Garden Village Location Near Amenities Immaculately Presented Walking Distance To Egerton Primary School Deceptively Spacious 3-Bed Semi-Detached Stone Cottage In The Heart Of Egerton Nestled along the main road in Egerton village, this immaculately presented and deceptively spacious semi-detached stone cottage boasts an impressive 1,685 sq. Ft. Of beautifully designed living space. Entering through the main entrance on the private road, Globe Lane off Blackburn Road, you're greeted by a convenient porch that leads into a generous dining roomâ€”an inviting space ideal for both entertaining and daily living. From here, the home unfolds effortlessly, showcasing a perfect balance of period charm and modern comfort. Spacious & Characterful Living Areas Designed with both style and practicality in mind, the ground floor exudes character with original timber-beamed ceilings and a thoughtful layout. The generous living room extends across the width of the house, illuminated by two large leaded windows to the front and one to the side, filling the space with natural light. The neutral dÃ©cor provides a timeless backdrop, while a striking original fireplace with a wood-burning stove sits against a statement wall adorned in Morris & Co 'Seaweed Haines' wallpaper, adding a touch of heritage charm. Opposite the dining room, the well-appointed kitchen is both stylish and highly functional. Featuring grey-green timber grain-effect shaker-style units arranged in a practical u-shape, it offers ample storage and workspace, complemented by timber-style worktops. The ceramic sink and drainer, positioned under the window, provides a lovely view over the rear garden. Modern appliances, including an integrated electric oven, four-ring gas hob with concealed extractor, dishwasher, fridge, and freezer, ensure convenience, while a separate utility room with a WC is neatly tucked to the side for added practicality. Three Beautiful Bedrooms & a Stunning Four-Piece Bathroom The first floor offers three well-proportioned bedrooms, each filled with light and charm. The main bedroom, features a striking original stone fireplace, a beautiful feature wall, and two built-in wardrobes adding both character and functionality. The spacious four-piece family bathroom is designed with a luxurious feel, comprising a WC, wall-mounted vanity sink, panelled bath, and a separate glazed-screen showerâ€”a perfect space to unwind after a long day. Converted Attic â€“ A Flexible & Inviting Space A staircase leads to the second floor, where a converted loft space offers endless possibilities. Split into two distinct areas, including a large attic room and an adjoining loft storage space, this versatile floor could serve as a home office, guest bedroom, or creative studio. Velux-style windows bring in natural light and fabulous views over the moors, while eaves storage maximises practicality without compromising style. Cottage-Style Gardens & Prime Village Location Step outside into the charming, well-kept cottage-style garden, where a paved patio leads up to a raised area with a shed at the rearâ€”a perfect retreat for relaxing or entertaining. Thoughtfully landscaped with mature planting and inviting seating areas, the garden provides a peaceful escape, despite the home's prime location in the village of Egerton. With no direct neighbours at the rear of the property, it offers exceptional privacy and a wonderfully quiet setting. Additionally, there is potential to create a parking space where the shed is currently located, providing added convenience if desired. Perfectly situated for easy access to local amenities, stunning countryside walks, and excellent schools, this home combines traditional charm with modern convenience. With immaculate presentation, spacious interiors, and an enviable location, this rare and characterful property is a fantastic opportunity to own a true piece of Egertonâ€™s history. description: The Perfect First Time Buy Located in the Heart of Monton Village Period Terraced Property Presented with a Modern Twist Two Reception Rooms Fitted Modern Kitchen Two Generous Double Bedrooms Spacious Three Piece Bathroom Suite Low Maintenance Rear Garden that Benefits from the Sun Located just a Short Walk to an Array of Shops, Bars and Restaurants Well Served by Public Transport and Motorway Links This period terraced property, presented with a modern twist, is the ideal opportunity for first-time buyers looking to settle down in the vibrant Monton Village. Situated in a sought-after location, this charming home boasts two reception rooms and a fitted modern kitchen on the ground floor. Whilst the first floor of this lovely home benefits from two generously sized double bedrooms and complemented by the spacious three piece bathroom suite. Outside, the low maintenance rear garden is the perfect place to soak up the sun and enjoy the outdoors in privacy. Located just a short walk to an array of shops, bars, and restaurants, this property offers the perfect blend of convenience and character. Well served by public transport and motorway links, the daily commute to work could not be easier. Don't miss out on the opportunity to make this charming property your own. Contact us today to secure your viewing today! EPC Rating: C Location Monton village is a highly sought after, thriving village within close proximity of Manchester City Centre. With boutique and independent retailers dotted along Monton Road, Montonâ€™s range of shops give the area character â€“ you can find a specialist craft beer bottle shop, a jewellers and a home and lifestyle shop along the main shopping street, to name but a few. With an amazing range of coffee shops, bars and restaurants, Monton is a great place to go out to eat. Youâ€™ll find bars with heated terraces suitable for alfresco dining, wine and cocktail bars and venues that provide live music â€“ there is a real buzz around Monton! On the edge of Monton village is the Historic Bridgewater Canal, perfect for weekend walks. The picturesque Roe Green Loopline Heritage Trail is a convenient circular walk that begins and ends in Monton village, taking you along the canal towpath. Monton has schools of a consistently high standard, including Branwood Preparatory School and Monton Green Primary School which have consistently received Good Ofsted reports. Situated between the M602 and the A580 East Lancs Road, the village of Monton is only a 20 minute drive from Manchester city centre and a 10 minute drive from MediaCity. Monton village is serviced by rail services passing through the stations of Patricroft and Eccles, along the Manchester Victoria-Liverpool Lime Street railway line. description: Modernised in last 3 1â„2 years 0.3 distance to Lostock train station Substantial open plan, kitchen and living area plus separate snug/gaming room. Two of the bedrooms in particular are very large Low maintenance, rear garden designed for entertaining Fantastic, curb appeal with double apex Separate utility and generous garage Potential to create additional ensuite Located just off Regent Road The Home: Our clients purchased this property just over three years ago from a family who had owned the property since its initial construction. Whilst the property had been well cared for during the lengthy ownership, aesthetically and layout wise the home was dated and subsequently a significant program of modernisation has taken place with a reconfiguration and an extension having now been completed. The result is a stunning home with modern curb appeal by way of double apex roofline, neutral rendering and anthracite windows. The driveway has been enlarged to accommodate family sized parking whilst the garage has been retained. There is scope for further conversion should additional ground floor space or bedroom be required. The two primary bedrooms with their vaulted ceilings should allow this home to stand out from the crowd. This truly is one not to be missed and an early viewing is recommended. The property is Freehold Council Tax is Band F - Â£3,318.18 The Area: Morris Fold Drive is located just off Regent Road which is located within the heart of Lostock and is seen by many as one of the more prestigious roads within the area. A particularly strong feature of the road is access to Lostock train station which is around 0.3 miles away and links to Manchester and its airport. Lostock County Primary School is just a few minutes from the property and the train station itself and many people buy within this area seeking good access to the private schooling on offer within the town (Bolton School is just over 2 miles away). Whilst the train station is well placed, Junction 5 and 6 of the M61 are also easily accessible. The closest commercial centre is within the out-of-town retail complex close to the Toughsheet Community Stadium at the Middlebrook retail complex which includes a number of supermarkets and large outlets together with gym, bowling alley, cinema, restaurants etc. There are also two golf courses and a tennis club within easy walking distance. Many locals also consider Manchester and the Trafford Centre as an appropriate distance for both socialising and work. Whilst many of these features are ideal for living within a commuter belt of a large city, the town also boasts very popular countryside including a stretch of the West Pennine Moors and Winter Hill. title: 8 bed farm for sale Slack Fold Lane, Farnworth, 0 BL4
description: Charming Detached Farmhouse 360Â° Countryside Views With 2.72-Acre Field & Six Separate Garden Areas To The Main House: Five Bedroom/ Three Reception/ Four Bathrooms Additional One-Bedroom Studio, One-Bedroom Cottage And Two-Bedroom Cottage; Each Furnished With Bathroom, Lounge And Kitchen. Flexible Accommodation Ideal For Large Families, Airbnb Rental Or Self-Contained Business Units Private Gated Driveway & Parking For At Least Six Cars Total Floor Space Approx 2270 Sq. Ft. No Chain 5-Bed Detached Property With 2 Separate Annex Properties (Total 8 Bedrooms) Substantial Family Home Set In A Picturesque Location Escape the hustle and bustle of modern life and rediscover the restorative charms of the countryside at Holme Fold Farm, in Farnworth. A home filled with rich history, that is of the land, Holme Fold Farm is a true character home, brimming with original features including centuriesâ€™ old, exposed beams. Dating back to 1830, this former farmhouse has so much potential; with spacious rooms, a studio annex and two independent cottages, its flexibility is limitless â€“ from family home with ample guest accommodation to hotel, farm, smallholding, lifestyle business; the versatility of the buildings and 2.7 acres of land cannot be underestimated. A warm welcome Pull through the bespoke iron gates and along a lengthy driveway, where there is ample parking for at least six cars, before making your way to the porch entrance, where a multifuel stove provides a buffer of warmth as you step indoors away from the elements. To the right, make your way into the sitting room, where an incredible carved wood and redbrick original fireplace houses a gas fire. Currently used as a study, this cosy room features handsome exposed beams to the ceiling, with quality, hardwearing carpet underfoot. On windy days, shut the door to the world and feel the solidity of the thick stone walls, retaining warmth in winter and keeping a cool interior in the summer months. Wine and dine Opening up from the sitting room is the dining room, where a traditional look, real-flame gas fire adds rustic glow. Deep set windows frame views out over the courtyard whilst beams overhead â€“ sourced from ancient ships â€“ infuse this characterful room with olde worlde warmth. Conveniently connected to the dining room, follow the easy flow of Holme Fold Farm through to the kitchen, where original flagstone flooring adds authentic farmhouse charm underfoot. Practical and robust, this flooring is perfectly in keeping with the country-style cabinetry that surrounds, providing plenty of storage. Traditional touches Overhead, in the white painted beams, original meat hooks can still be spied. With plenty of space for freestanding appliances beneath the solid oak worktops, there is ample potential to update this kitchen, with scope to open it up to the studio apartment beyond, creating a modern open-plan dining-kitchen. Views extend over the cobblestone courtyard, filled with colour and planted with flowers, trees and shrubs. Ideal for family living, room leads on from room at Holme Fold Farm, with the kitchen conveniently connecting to the front lounge. A superbly sized family room, modern spotlighting balances against the original beams inlaid within the ceiling above. Warmth fills the room from the stove, set within a handsome exposed redbrick surround, whilst views extend over the front garden. Bedtime beckons Completing the loop of the home, ascend the stairs from the sitting room to arrive on the upstairs landing, where recently fitted pale grey carpets harmonise with the white walls for a calming feel. On the left, discover bedroom four, a good-sized double bedroom offering incredible views over the front of the home, with fields unfurling as far as the eye can see. A sunny, south-facing room, catch the sunrise and sunsets from this bedroom, and spy deer roaming the dew-covered meadows. Freshen up in the bathroom opposite, beautifully proportioned and furnished with a traditional clawfoot bathtub, shower, wash basin with traditional taps and WC. Resin flooring, impervious to water, is practical underfoot. Pale grey and white tones mingle with rustic black beams. Coming out of here, turn right to arrive at bedroom three, another good size double framing views out over the courtyard. Room for all Opposite, the largest bedroom awaits, bright and airy, and following the same soothing grey and white decorative motif as the preceding bedrooms. Furnished in traditional fashion, this bedroom is a true sanctuary. Further along the landing, sneak a peek at the fitted storage, before arriving at bedroom two on the left, a room with ample storage and served by its own shower room ensuite. Overlooking the courtyard to the rear, also furnished with a soothing shower room ensuite, is a sixth bedroom. Dressed in white and grey, each bedroom and bathroom has its own fresh, contemporary feel. Rental potential With six bedrooms and so much space in the main home, consider the potential of the studio one-bedroom annex, one-bedroom cottage and two-bedroom cottage which also come with Holme Fold Farm; each furnished with bathroom, lounge and kitchen. Ideal as overspill accommodation for large families, for Airbnb rental or even as self-contained business units, the potential is vast. Outdoor living Outside, a coal shed and cycle shed provide plenty of storage (an old-fashioned door in the rear garden, once used for coal deliveries is a hint to the 1800s origins of the home). Six areas of garden provide different pockets of privacy in which to relax, unwind and appreciate the peaceful rural setting of Holme Fold Farm. Perfect for childrenâ€™s games, a formally planted area accompanies a picnicking area with bench seating. Wildlife is in abundance, encouraged by mature trees and hedging, which also provide privacy and shelter. Owner quote: â€œYou could have your own swimming pool, gym or llama farm; all the potential is there.â€ Make your way to the 2.72-acre field, a sufficient size for two horses, and survey the sublime surroundings. Observe the 320-degree open country views, taking in the distinct beauty of six counties, including snow-capped moorlands and sunny meadows. Watch the new year fireworks beneath a blanket and with a flask of mulled wine. Additional outbuildings include a barn currently used for storage and a large shipping container, used as a lock up. On your doorstep Enjoy the peace and quiet of the countryside at Holme Fold Farm, surrounded by fields and where at night you can sit out and hear the bats flitting about, replaced by the piercing cries of buzzards in the daytime. Rurality and refuge come replete with convenience and connectivity, with five supermarkets close by, the nearest only eight minutes away. Dip into the hustle and bustle of the world with a trip to the cinema, only 15 minutesâ€™ drive from the door, whilst the Middlebrook Retail Park is just over ten minutesâ€™ drive away. Families are well served by a plethora of local primary, state and secondary schools, whilst the independent Bolton School is also less than 15 minutesâ€™ drive away. Commute with ease; the motorway junction is only five minutes from the door â€“ though youâ€™d never know it. The vast greenery of Great Lever and Farnworth Golf Club provides a buffer between Holme Fold Farm and the Royal Bolton Hospital â€“ a mere five or so minutesâ€™ drive away. Owner quote: â€œOne minute youâ€™re in a semi-rural world; the next you can be in suburbia surrounded by modern life.â€ For those who love character properties and are looking for the flexibility to build their own life around them, Holme Fold Farm is a versatile oasis of calm, wherein you can escape the inflexibility of modern life. description: Sold by Modern Method of Auction Sought-after Hale Barns location Three bedroom semi-detached home Well-maintained rear garden with patio area and garden room Spacious driveway Excellent transport links No chain Positioned in a peaceful cul-de-sac, this superb three-bedroom semi-detached home offers well-balanced accommodation with a bright, modern feel throughout. Located in the desirable Hale Barns area, the property enjoys excellent access to local amenities, highly regarded schools, and convenient transport links to Altrincham, Manchester Airport, and the wider motorway network. The ground floor opens with a welcoming entrance hall leading into a spacious lounge and dining area, ideal for both everyday living and entertaining. The dining space provides direct access to the rear garden, while the adjacent fitted kitchen offers ample storage and a sleek finish. Off the kitchen is a practical utility room, and completing the ground floor is a useful downstairs WC. To the first floor, there are three generously sized bedrooms, all filled with natural light. A stylish family bathroom serves the accommodation, finished with modern tiling and quality fittings. Externally, the property benefits from a private driveway to the front, providing off-road parking. The rear garden is well maintained, with a lawn and patio area offering the perfect setting for outdoor dining, entertaining, or childrenâ€™s play. Combining a sought-after location with attractive, well-presented interiors, this property represents an excellent opportunity for buyers seeking a home ready to enjoy. This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer, or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability, and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.50% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of Â£6,600 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of Â£300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change. You may be recommended services by the Agent/iam-Sold. Recommended services are optional and the Agent or iam-Sold will receive payment from the provider where recommended services are taken. As such you should consider your options before accepting recommended services. Read full description In partnership with Zoopla insights Sign in and gain expert analysis to make informed decisions.

A third, single bedroom offers versatility for a child's room or a home office. The modern three-piece family bathroom completes this floor, designed with a contemporary finish. Externally, the property enjoys a large driveway at the front, with ample space for multiple vehicles, offering great convenience for families or guests. Hadleigh Close is situated in a family-friendly neighborhood, within easy reach of Bolton's town center, where you'll find a wide variety of shops, restaurants, and cafes. description: Grand Detached Stone Home Set In 1 Acre Six Large Bedrooms (Three Ensuite) Five Spacious Reception Rooms Private Gated Entrance & Driveway Open-Plan Kitchen & Dining Leisure Facilities â€“ Pool, jacuzzi, steam room, gym, and decked terrace Self-Contained Annex â€“ Ideal for guests, staff, or rental. Extensive Grounds & Parking â€“ Landscaped gardens, double garage. Investment Potential- Marketed for sale on behalf of joint receivers. Prime Location A Grand Detached Stone Estate With Immense Potential Over 10,000 Sq Ft. *Recently Reduced By Our Motivated Vendors By Â£250,000* Step into a charming eight-bedroom detached stone property, brimming with character and untapped potential. Nestled within its own private grounds, in Dunscar Fold, Egerton this home offers the perfect opportunity for those looking to restore and modernise a truly spacious and traditional estate, combining period charm with the chance to make it your own. Impressive Entrance and Driveway Accessed through remote-controlled electric gates, an illuminated driveway leads to the property, where the stunning stonework and grand features immediately capture your attention. The house is set within its own grounds, with a beautiful yet slightly weathered exterior, waiting for the right buyer to revive its former glory. The stately entrance hall, with high ceilings, detailed coving, and ceramic-tiled floors, leads you into the heart of the home, ready for a modern makeover. Grand Reception Rooms The formal lounge, flooded with natural light through double aspect bay windows, offers a glimpse of its past grandeur with elegant wooden floors and intricate detailing. The formal dining room, complete with large windows, a charming fireplace, and classic parquet flooring, radiates timeless eleganceâ€”ready to be revived to its full potential. A spacious sitting room/office features a fireplace flanked by built-in shelving and a striking feature wall adorned with bookcase wallpaper. At the rear of the ground floor, the expansive family room boasts a large fireplace and parquet floors, stretching up to the fifth reception room on the first floor. This room is highlighted by a grand arched window overlooking the outdoor decking area, with access to the rear courtyard tooâ€”perfect for cosy seating areas. With ample space for a pool table, family games, and direct access to the leisure facilities, this room is ready to become the heart of entertainment, awaiting your personal touch. Open-Plan Kitchen and Dining Area The expansive open-plan breakfast kitchen and dining area offers a blank canvas, featuring black granite countertops, a Belfast sink, and sleek grey gloss L-shaped cabinetry with an island unit. Thereâ€™s ample space for a freestanding oven, complemented by a stainless steel extractor hood above, an integrated dishwasher, and plumbing for an American fridge/freezer. The kitchen is tiled, while oak flooring extends into the dining area. With a bit of updating, this space has the potential to become a fantastic culinary haven. Double-glazed doors from the dining area open to the front garden, providing stunning views of the grounds. Additionally, a staircase leads down to the cellar for extra storage or potential use. The downstairs also features a stone-flagged boot room with a large door leading directly to the rear courtyard, offering easy access to outdoor spaces. Adjacent to this, the separate cloakroom with built-in cupboards provides convenient storage, making it an ideal area for refurbishing into a highly functional and stylish entryway. This space offers great potential to enhance both the practicality and charm of the home. Elegant Bedrooms and Bathrooms Awaiting Revival The dramatic staircase with its glazed balustrade leads to the six spacious bedrooms, three of which offer en suite shower rooms. While the main bedroom has a dressing area, the main bathroom is generously sized and includes a jacuzzi bathâ€”both areas awaiting modern updates and finishing touches. Leisure Facilities with Great Potential The leisure facilities, including a swimming pool, jacuzzi, steam room, and gymnasium. Large patio doors lead to a timber decked terrace, where you can enjoy peaceful views over the sprawling lawn out towards Winter Hill. With care and modernisation, this space could transform into the perfect private escape. Self-Contained Annex for Versatile Use The self-contained one-bedroom annex offers versatilityâ€”ideal for a family member, housekeeper, or as an independent living space. Extensive Grounds and Parking A double garage offers ample storage, and the grounds are beautifully landscaped enjoying fabulous sunsets, surrounded by mature trees and woodland. The gravel driveway leads to the front of the property, providing a sense of arrival in a tranquil setting and space for plenty vehicles to park. A Property with a Storied History and Investment Potential This estate is more than just a home; it has been featured on The Hairy Bikers Go North for Christmas in 2021, showcasing its unique charm to a wide audience. It has also served as a remarkable venue, hosting large groups of up to 20 guests. The size and layout of the property, along with its serene setting, make it a prime candidate for a range of conversion opportunities. Whether you are considering it for residential or commercial useâ€”such as a nursing home, nursery, or other purposeâ€”this property offers great scope for transformation. Prime Location with Excellent Amenities & Transport Links Situated in the highly sought-after area of Egerton, Bolton, this property enjoys excellent connectivity and proximity to a wealth of amenities. With easy access to the A666, commuting is seamless, and nearby public transport options include frequent bus routes along Blackburn Road and Darwen Road. Bromley Cross Station, less than a mile away, provides regular train links to Clitheroe and Manchester, perfect for shopping trips or evenings out. A fantastic selection of local restaurants awaits in Bromley Cross, Dunscar, and Egerton Village, offering a variety of dining options. For outdoor enthusiasts, the surrounding countryside provides endless opportunities for scenic walks, with Winter Hill visible from the property. Enjoy a round of golf at Dunscar or Turton Golf Clubs, or take a stroll to the historic Turton Tower. Bromley Cross is well-equipped with everyday essentials, including Sainsburyâ€™s, Co-op, and Lidl, while the Middlebrook Retail Parkâ€”just 15 minutes awayâ€”offers cinemas and a wider selection of shops. For fitness enthusiasts, the leisure centre at the Last Drop Village provides excellent facilities for training and exercise. Families will appreciate the access to excellent schools, including Walmsley, Eagley, and St. Johnâ€™s Primary

description: Four-Bedroom Semi Detached Property 1126 sq. Feet of Accommodation Dining Kitchen with Appliances Showstopping Family Bathroom with Four-Piece Suite Gardens to Front and Rear Off Road Parking for Multiple Vehicles No Onward Chain Tucked away in a peaceful cul-de-sac just off Mossy Lea Road, this beautifully presented four-bedroom semi-detached property is ready for a family to move straight in and make it their own. Set on a generous plot in the charming parish of Wrightington, the home boasts exceptional finishes throughout including a super spacious kitchen and a stunning modern bathroom. Wrightington is renowned for its blend of prestigious country homes and idyllic West Lancashire countryside. Though wonderfully rural, it offers easy access to the nearby villages of Shevington and Standish for everyday amenities, and excellent transport links via the M6, making it an ideal retreat for commuters looking to escape to the countryside after a busy day. Inside, the home offers over 1,126 sq. Ft. Of well-planned living space with a light and tasteful dÃ©cor throughout. The newly built entrance hall welcomes you and is spacious and bright with a built-in cloaks cupboard and staircase leading to the first floor. Beautiful herringbone flooring and an infra red ceiling mounted panel warms the area. The open-plan lounge and dining room stretch the full depth of the property, filled with natural light from the dual aspect windows and French doors opening to the rear garden. A feature fireplace with a coal-effect living flame gas fire adds warmth and character to the space. The spacious 15' kitchen/diner is ideal for entertaining, fitted with a stylish range of beech-effect units, laminated worktops and quality integrated appliances including a double oven, gas hob with extractor, fridge/freezer, and dishwasher. Completing the ground floor is a showstopping family bathroom, recently refurbished to a high standard. The contemporary four-piece suite includes a wall-mounted wash basin, WC, panelled bath and separate shower cubicle, finished with a chrome towel rail and modern floor tiling. Upstairs, the landing leads to the bright and well-proportioned bedrooms (one of which is currently used as a study and is perfect for working from home). The master bedroom includes built-in storage, and there is an additional two-piece WC for convenience. Externally, the gravelled driveway provides off-road parking for multiple vehicles. The front garden features a well-maintained lawn and mature shrub borders, whilst the rear garden is a true highlight â€“ a beautifully landscaped space with a lawn, timber shed, and a large timber decked area perfect for outdoor entertaining. It should also be noted that the current owners of this home have invested in making the home particularly energy efficient. Solar panels and battery storage have been added and our client advises current electric bills are approximately Â£60PCM including the charging of two electric vehicles.
