description: Detached House Filled With Character Dating Back To 17th Century Four Bedrooms Two Reception Rooms Cottage Style Breakfast Kitchen Modern En-Suite & Bathroom Approx 1/2 Acre Plot Off-Road Parking Fabulous Landscaped Gardens Nestled in a truly idyllic setting on the doorstep of Healey Dell Nature Reserve, this charming four-bedroom detached property dates back to the 1600s and effortlessly combines period character with modern comforts. A rare gem of local heritage, the home occupies a generous 1â„2 acre plot offering privacy, tranquillity, and picturesque surroundings. Boasting approximately 2,300 sq. Ft. Of beautifully appointed accommodation, the property features original beams and stone fireplaces tastefully preserved and enhanced to retain its unique historical character. The generous layout is perfect for family living and entertaining, with each room offering a warm, welcoming feel. The lower ground and ground floor comprises a character-filled lounge with exposed beams and a large inglenook fireplace, a cosy sitting room/dining room, and a country-style kitchen with integrated appliances, stone flooring, and garden views. A utility room, and guest WC complete the ground floor accommodation. There is also a store room that could be converted into additional living accommodation. Upstairs, the property offers four well-proportioned bedrooms, including a superb principal suite with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room. The family bathroom is finished to a high standard, featuring a superb walk-in shower. Set within private, mature gardens, the property enjoys ample parking, and the grounds include lawns, patio areas, and well-stocked borders, providing a peaceful retreat and ideal space for outdoor living and entertaining. Positioned right by Healey Dell Nature Reserve, residents benefit from miles of scenic walking trails and wildlife-rich landscapes, while excellent local schools, shops, and transport links (including access to the M62) are just a short drive away. A truly unique and characterful family home offering a rare blend of history, charm, and space in one of Rochdaleâ€™s most sought-after semi-rural locations. description: No chain Manchester commuter belt Extended accommodation Two reception rooms plus conservatory Three double bedrooms High-quality location with great access to the A6 Motorway link around 1 mile Train station around 1.5 miles Mature well-tended garden Ground floor shower room and first floor bathroom Occupying a generous plot within this very popular section of Newbrook Road which allows great access towards the A6. The property has been owned within the same family for just over 50 years and this immediate group of homes has been very settled over the years which is a great indicator to the quality of location and neighbours. Benefiting from extensions to the rear, there are two reception rooms with the addition of a conservatory and to the first floor there are three double bedrooms served by the family bathroom. To provide extra flexibility to the arrangement there is a ground floor shower room which has also been added. Externally, the gardens have been very well tended over the years and during spring and summer burst into colour. There is a sizable garage, workshop and a group of sheds one of which has power, water and is insulated which in the past has been used as a dark room but now functions as a laundry room. Homes within this top section of Newbrook Road often generate speedy rates of sale and therefore viewing is strongly advised. The property is Leasehold for a term of 999 (less 10 days) years from 1st October 1923 subject to the payment of a yearly Ground Rent of Â£5.87 Council Tax is Band D - Â£2,259.51 Set within the commuter belt towards Manchester with train and motorway links around 1.5 and 1 mile respectively. The home is located close to the A6 and therefore is ideally placed for access along the main road network. There is access to out of town retail developments approximately 5 miles away plus the Trafford Centre is roughly 10 miles away and just a short hop down the motorway. The area also has access to more traditional smaller town centres such as Westhoughton, Horwich and Atherton. The area has long been regarded as a popular and convenient area to reside and will most certainly recommend an early viewing. The inviting property is located on the third floor of the New Sedgwick development which is a remarkable former cotton mill steeped in history with exposed brickwork running through the communal areas and an impressive glass atrium. description: Presented to an Excellent Standard Throughout! Spacious Contemporary Design Two Generous Double Bedrooms Two Stylish Bathroom Suites Secure Gated Entrance Beautiful Open-Plan Living / Kitchen/ Dining Area Highly Popular Private Development Excellent Transport Links Driveway Parking Shops and Local Amenities Nearby Millbrooke Estate Agents are delighted to bring to the market this incredible mews property. Ideally situated on the luxury, gated Chaddock Hall Drive development just off Chaddock Lane, Astley on the outskirts of Worsley. The development is rich in history and the perfect location for young professionals with the trendy Astley Point just a short walk away offering access to a bar and multiple restaurants. Easy access to the Bridgewater Canal for stunning scenic walks all year round and a drink or meal in one of the local waterside pubs. The property has been lovingly and stylishly finished with a modern and contemporary theme throughout. Offering fantastic open plan living space on the first floor opening onto the terrace where you can enjoy those summer evenings with Al Fresco dining. The bedrooms and bathrooms are situated on the lower level and are presented to the highest of standards. Externally the grounds can be enjoyed by all with a small pond and community entertaining space where the residents host seasonal gatherings. The property has two parking spaces and the secure gated entrance is controlled via your phone. The entrance hallway on the ground floor includes a clever closet storage space which has been custom built to maximise the under stair space along with a utility room area. The master bedroom is bright and welcoming and incorporates an en-suite shower room. There is a generous second double bedroom and a stunning, stylish and contemporary three piece family bathroom with shower. To the first floor is the vast and semi-open plan lounge/kitchen/diner. The lounge is flooded with natural light and features a custom media wall incorporating a TV space and electric fire. Vast ceilings with original timbers from the site create a warm and homely atmosphere. The kitchen and dining spaces are well appointed and include integrated appliances. This exquisite property has been lovingly and stylishly finished to create a combined, contemporary yet charming theme throughout. Offering fantastic open plan living space and outside entertaining, early internal viewing is highly recommended! A spacious driveway leads to an integrated garage, providing plenty of space for family living or weekend visitors. Step Inside â€“ Where Style and Detail Meet Cross the threshold into a hallway that makes an instant impression â€“ stretching elegantly ahead and setting the tone for the rest of the home. Wood-effect tiled flooring runs underfoot, complementing the soft grey damask-style wallcovering that adds a touch of classic sophistication. Radiator covers add a neat, bespoke feel, while the staircase â€“ complete with timber and stainless-steel handrails and a stair runner carpet finished with chrome rods â€“ draws the eye upwards with a sense of quiet grandeur. The expansive living and dining area is decorated in a calming white with a feature grey damask wall that echoes the elegance of the hallway. At its centre, furniture is thoughtfully arranged around an inset gas fire, with a recessed TV above, beautifully backlit within the chimney breast â€“ creating a sleek, modern focal point. Timber laminate flooring adds warmth underfoot and effortlessly leads into the showstopping sitting room, where under floor heating awaits. This glass-enclosed sanctuary is a masterclass in light and air. Large-format floor tiles, remote open and close Keylight skylights, and bifolding doors blur the line between inside and out â€“ ideal for entertaining on warm summer evenings or enjoying a cosy night in as recessed spotlights softly illuminate the space. A statement twig effect wallpaper adds texture and interest, bringing the outside in and completing the tranquil, contemporary aesthetic. The Kitchen, Refined and Reimagined A perfect balance of style and practicality, the kitchen has been thoughtfully designed with modern living in mind. Expansive white marble-effect worktops provide ample space for cooking and casual dining, complete with a sleek breakfast bar, matching upstand, and splashback. The matt grey handleless units are subtly curved at the edges, offering a smooth, contemporary finish that pairs beautifully with the clean white walls and Moroccan-inspired grey tiled flooring. Every element feels considered. Integrated appliances include an oven, microwave, drawer warmer and induction hob- all Neff, with a discreet downdraft extractor. Including a Siemens fridge and freezer and a Haier wine cooler. An inset sink sits just beneath the window, allowing for peaceful views while you prep. Under-cabinet lighting and recessed ceiling spotlights add both atmosphere and clarity, illuminating the space with a soft, warm glow. A flowing layout takes you through to the utility room â€“ fitted with matching cabinetry and flooring for a seamless look. With and integrated Beko double fridge/ freezer, plumbing for a washing machine and tumble dryer, plus a door to the garden, this space blends functionality with style. Whether you're preparing a relaxed breakfast or hosting an evening with friends, this kitchen truly is the heart of the home. Flexible Living â€“ The Perfect Multi-Use Space To the front of the home, a third reception room adds valuable versatility. Currently used as a stylish salon, itâ€™s ideal for anyone running a business from home. Alternatively, it could make a fantastic home office, playroom, or even a fifth bedroom. Laminate flooring and silvery grey wallcovering create a chic, professional feel, while white walls and a large front-facing window bathe the room in natural light. A Flexible Family Home Upstairs, four beautifully presented bedrooms offer comfort, privacy, and practicality for every member of the household. The main bedroom is a spacious sanctuary, flooded with natural light from two large windows overlooking the front aspect. A full wall of built-in wardrobes provides excellent storage, while the luxurious en-suite is finished to a high standard. A slate-effect shower enclosure with smoked-glass screens takes centre stage, complemented by textured feature tiling. The bespoke vanity unit houses a countertop bowl sink with an illuminated mirror above, flanked by fitted storage cupboards and a WC. Open shelving with integrated spotlighting is neatly built into the pelmet and plinth, while striking black and white geometric floor tiles complete the sophisticated look. Bedroom two, also to the front of the home, includes its own en-suite and comes with built-in wardrobes, overhead storage, and matching bedside cabinets. The en-suite features a WC, wall-hung vanity basin with gloss-finished shelving beneath, a glazed shower enclosure, built-in storage cupboard, and beige-cream tiling for a soft, calming finish. To the rear, two further bedrooms overlook the garden, both bathed in natural light. One is finished with a soft feather-print wallcovering and laminate flooring, while the other boasts a damask feature wall and plush carpeting, ideal for a guest room or a tranquil retreat. Completing the first floor is the contemporary family bathroom â€“ elegant and functional. It features a WC, a tiled-in bath with shower above and glazed screen, a wall-hung vanity unit with glossy drawer storage beneath, and an illuminated mirror above. The beige textured tiling and chrome heated towel rail bring a spa-like finish to this calming space. The loft is accessible via a wooden loft ladder and is partially boarded, providing useful storage space. Garden Escapes & Alfresco Evenings The south-facing rear garden is a beautifully curated space, designed with both practicality and pleasure in mindâ€”a true masterclass in stylish, low-maintenance outdoor living. Every corner has been thoughtfully considered to create zones for relaxation, entertainment, and everyday enjoyment. A sleek porcelain tiled patio is framed by chunky oak sleepers, offering a grounded, natural contrast and a rustic edge to the modern aesthetic. A low-maintenance artificial lawn provides a lush, evergreen centrepieceâ€”perfect for children to play or for simply lounging under the sun without the hassle of upkeep. Step further and you'll find a stunning composite decked terrace, complete with recessed lighting that twinkles underfoot as day turns to night. Built-in raised planters line the rear and side of the decking, bursting with seasonal colour and greenery that softens the clean lines and brings a sense of tranquillity to the space. This area is perfectly positioned for alfresco dining, drinks with friends, or simply unwinding with a good book. In one corner, the garden takes on a playful, sociable twist with a bespoke timber garden room, proudly marked as the â€œBeer Garden.â€ Whether youâ€™re hosting weekend BBQs, summer garden parties, or retreating with a nightcap beneath the stars, this is an outdoor haven that truly elevates everyday living. Private, secure, and effortlessly stylishâ€”this garden isnâ€™t just a backdrop, itâ€™s a destination. Out & About The Beeches offers an incredibly convenient location. A short walk takes you to the Smithills Hall Estate, where you can enjoy picturesque forest trails and woodlands, all easily accessible without the need for a car. For dining, indulge in Mediterranean cuisine at San Marino, or head to Lottieâ€™s of Belmont, a delightful farm shop and cafÃ© just 2.5 miles from your doorstep. Feed the animals before savoring delicious teas and cakes. Just a ten-minute drive away, Tockholes Woods presents a variety of walking paths, including a beautiful route leading to Darwen Tower. Several local pubs provide ideal spots to relax and unwind after a stroll. For your everyday essentials, Top Shop, a popular local grocer and convenience store, is close by, where you can pick up a pint of milk or grab a quick bite to eatâ€”from a bacon and duck egg barm to fresh fruit and penny sweets. Astley Bridge, with its shops and convenience stores, is also just a short walk away. Families will appreciate the proximity to schools, with several located just five minutes away. Manchester is only a 20-minute train ride from Hall iâ€™ thâ€™ Wood and Bromley Cross stations, both approximately a mile and a half by car. Additionally, Sharples and Thornleigh high schools are nearby, and High Lawn Primary School is just a short walk from home. With its spacious interior and thoughtfully designed outdoor space, this property isnâ€™t just a houseâ€”itâ€™s a forever home. A rare find that doesnâ€™t often come onto the market. description: High specification kitchen and bathrooms No chain Open plan kitchen with living area to rear Substantial integral double garage M61 motorway link approximately 2.5 miles Lostock train station approximately half a mile Bolton school around 2.3 miles Ideal Manchester commuter belt Lostock Primary School around 0.6 miles by car The Home: No chain A large six-bedroom detached home located within a prestigious area. Under half a mile from Lostock train station and so ideally placed for those wishing to commute to Manchester city centre, Manchester airport and also towards London. Regents Hill is a cul-de-sac of just nine impressive homes. Some particularly outstanding features are the master bedroom suite, which occupies the entire second floor and includes an abundance of fitted furniture together with dressing room and modern en suite. The largest bedroom to the first floor is also substantial and includes a run of quality fitted furniture, plus en suite. The ground floor flows nicely with two formal reception rooms and an open-plan kitchen and living area which overlooks the garden. It is worth noting that the kitchen and sanitary wares have been replaced in recent years. There is a separate utility, providing discrete additional storage and further access to a large double integral garage, which may offer scope for further conversion should more ground floor accommodation be required. To the rear, you will find a low maintenance rear garden finished with artificial turf and well-proportioned patio. The sellers inform us that the property is Freehold. Lostock train station is less than half a mile away and therefore offers a perfect location for those commuting towards Manchester. For growing families, the area offers childcare from nursery level, with a number of primary schools (both state and private) within practical distance; the consistently popular Bolton School is around 2.5 miles away. Horwich town centre hosts many independently owned shops and services, whilst there is also a good selection of larger retail outlets at the Middlebrook retail development close to the football stadium. Manchester and the Trafford Centre are ideal locations to shop and to socialise due to their proximity and easy access. There are several sports clubs and gyms nearby and part of Middlebrook cycle trail is accessed immediately from Regent Road itself. title: 4 bed cottage for sale Knacks Lane, Prickshaw Village, Rochdale OL12
description: Semi-Detached Cottage Dating Back To 1823 Four Double Bedrooms Two Reception Rooms En-Suite & Family Bathroom Semi-Rural Location Off-Road Parking & Garage Quiet & Idyllic Hamlet Panoramic Countryside Views Full Of Character Nestled within the serene hamlet of Prickshaw Village, this exceptional four-bedroom semi-detached cottage offers a rare opportunity to acquire a truly unique home steeped in history and character. Formerly known as the 'Star House' and dating back to 1823, this beautifully converted former public house blends rustic charm with modern comfort, surrounded by breathtaking open countryside and positioned in a quiet, rural setting with a strong sense of community. Sympathetically renovated in 1993, the home retains many original features including exposed stonework, timber beams, and traditional fireplaces, while benefitting from a new roof, windows, and doors installed in 2022, offering peace of mind and energy efficiency. The spacious accommodation is arranged over four floors and briefly comprises: Cosy lounge and sitting room with wood-burning stoves, and a bright country-style kitchen with bespoke cabinetry and ample worktop space. There is also a convenient utility room, store room and wine cellar located on the basement level. Upstairs, the home continues to impress with four well-proportioned bedrooms, including a character-filled main with a modern en-suite shower room. Each bedroom boasts panoramic countryside views and is served by a stylish family bathroom. Externally, the cottage enjoys a charming stone facade and private outdoor space, ideal for al fresco dining or simply soaking in the tranquillity of the setting. Off-road parking is available, and the home sits within walking distance of numerous scenic footpaths, ideal for nature lovers and dog owners alike. Located within easy reach of Rochdale and major transport links, this property combines rural living with convenient access to town amenities. Whether you're seeking a character-filled family home or a peaceful retreat, this rare gem in Prickshaw Village must be viewed to be fully appreciated. title: 4 bed terraced house for sale Bury Old Road, Prestwich M25
description: Renovated Mid-Terrace Property Four Generous Bedrooms Beautifully Presented Interior Freehold Property South Facing Garden Stylish Contemporary Bathroom Excellent transport Links Many Local Amenities Nearby Spacious Living Accommodation Throughout Private Low Maintenance Garden Millbrooke Estate Agents are delighted to bring to the market this impressive semi-detached residence situated on the ever-popular Bury Old Road. Offering spacious accommodation spread over three floors, this beautifully presented home is a perfect choice for growing families or those seeking a home with versatile living space. As you enter the property via the porch you will be welcomed by an extensive lounge with bay window to the front elevation, offering fabulous living space. The beautifully fitted kitchen area offers modern wall and floor units and integrated appliances, offering a stylish area ideal for entertaining or informal dining. Positioned at the rear of the property this area is ideal for relaxing with family and friends and entertaining, with doors leading to private, south facing rear garden. A convenient guest W/C completes the ground floor accommodation. The first-floor hosts three generous bedrooms, all tastefully decorated and well-appointed. There is also a contemporary family bathroom with a stylish finish. The master bedroom is located on the second floor and benefits from natural lighting provided via skylight windows. Externally, the rear garden is maintenance free with high quality artificial grass and offers a decking seating area followed by a few steps down to the enclosed garden. The charming property is ideally located within a short walk to Heaton Park (via St Margarets entrance). Prestwich village itself offers an eclectic mix of bars, restaurants and independent retailers again only a short walk away, the Metrolink has its nearest tram station at Heaton Park and puts the city centre about ten minutes away and for those needing to travel further afield, the M60/M66/M62 motorway networks are all easily accessible on the Prestwich/Whitefield border at junction 17 of the M60. With its generous accommodation, immaculate presentation and prime location close to Prestwich Village, local amenities, schools, and transport links, this fabulous freeholds property ticks all the boxes and early viewing is highly recommended! title: 4 bed detached house for sale The Coppice, Bradshaw, Bolton, 3 BL2
description: Detached Family Home In Quiet Cul-De-Sac Four Bedrooms Plus Spacious Loft Room Stylish & Newly Fitted Kitchen Diner With Granite Worktops Cosy Lounge With Wood-Burning Stove Two Versatile Reception Rooms Contemporary Ensuite & Four-Piece Bathroom & Downstairs WC Bright Entrance Hall With Oak Staircase Large South-Facing Rear Garden With Patio And Lawn Integral Garage And Double Driveway Walking Distance To Harwood Village And Bromley Cross Station Spacious 4-Bedroom Detached Family Home In Quiet Cul-De-Sac In Bradshaw, Bl2 Welcome to The Coppice. Nestled behind manicured gardens and mature trees, just off Bradshaw Road in a quiet and friendly cul-de-sac, this well-presented four-bedroom detached family home offers a warm welcome, with a double driveway and integral garage providing everyday convenience in a leafy, peaceful setting. The Entrance Hall Step inside to a bright hallway where soft grey tones, tiled flooring, and a stunning oak staircase set the tone for the stylish interiors beyond. The Lounge Overlooking the rear garden, the spacious lounge is filled with light from large windows and patio doors. A wood-burning stove adds a cosy focal point, with a built-in wood store, recessed spotlights, and rich wood-effect flooring enhancing the inviting atmosphere. The garden connection makes it ideal for both relaxing nights in and summer gatherings. The Kitchen Diner Sleek and functional, the newly fitted kitchen diner features black granite worktops, deep green shaker-style cabinets, and integrated Siemens appliances including an oven, grill, and electric hob with stainless steel extractor. A dishwasher and space for an American-style fridge freezer add convenience, while the front garden outlook from the sink keeps the space light and bright. A separate utility room and ground-floor WC add practicality. The Sitting Room At the front of the home, a second reception room decorated in cheerful orange with a tiled floor offers versatilityâ€”perfect as a snug, playroom, home office or even guest room. Upstairs The first floor hosts four well-proportioned bedrooms. The main bedroom includes walnut-effect built-in wardrobes, drawers, and overhead storage, along with a sleek ensuite featuring a walk-in shower with glazed screen, mosaic shower floor, creamy wall and floor tiling, oak vanity unit and back-to-wall WC. Bedroom two, decorated in pale blue, is a comfortable double overlooking the front. Bedroom three, with green and grey walls, looks over the garden and fits a double bed. Bedroom four is currently used as a home office, also ideal as a nursery or single bedroom. A stylish four-piece family bathroom completes this floor, featuring a tiled-in bath, corner shower, wall-hung vanity unit, back-to-wall WC and travertine-style tiling. The Loft Room A bright and spacious loft conversion with skylights offers endless possibilitiesâ€”use it as a fifth bedroom, studio, cinema room, or teenage retreat. The Garden Private and secure, the south-facing rear garden is perfect for both entertaining and relaxing. A large patio, neat lawn, and mature planting are enclosed by timber fencing, making it ideal for children and pets. Thereâ€™s also rear access to the garage. The Location Set in a quiet spot in Bradshaw, this home is ideally located for families. St Maxentius Primary School is just up the path, with Canon Slade and Turton High close by. Harwood village is minutes away, offering everyday essentials including Morrisons, a local butcher, florist, hairdressers, beauty salons, a doctorâ€™s surgery, and a dentist. Bromley Cross train station is within a 10-minute walk, making commuting a breeze. Enjoy scenic walks around Jumbles Reservoir or unwind at local favourites like Bradshaw Cricket Club, The Nook & Cranny pub, Bill & Coo cafÃ© and wine bar, Porters Wine Bar, and CafÃ© 12 near Bradshaw Fisheries. Continue your walk up to The Pack Horse in Affetside for countryside views and a hearty meal. This spacious home offers a well-thought-out layout with flexibility to suit modern family life. There is excellent potential to extend to the rear if desired or to convert the garage into additional living spaceâ€”ideal for a growing family or those working from home. Sleep, Retreat, Repeat Upstairs, four double bedrooms await â€” each a peaceful escape from the everyday. Bedroom two, also front-facing, is light and airy with crisp white walls and the bonus of a shower tucked cleverly into the corner. A family bathroom completes the upper floor, fitted with a full-length bath and overhead shower, WC, and pedestal basin, framed with marble-effect wall panels for a sleek, low-maintenance finish. Children and pets will have room to roam, while adults can savour sundown drinks against a backdrop of stunning, uninterrupted views. The garden is a canvas, ready for your own touches. A Location to Love Located on the well-regarded Horseshoe Lane in Bromley Cross, this detached family home offers spacious living, panoramic views, and unbeatable access to local amenities. description: ***great oppurtunity for first time buyers or btl investors***over the road from bolton town centre*** Located on the periphery of Bolton town centre, this superbly positioned first-floor apartment presents an excellent investment opportunity for buy-to-let investors. The living room window provides a charming aspect towards the Town Hall clock, adding a touch of local character to the living space. The three-piece shower room suite includes a corner shower enclosure, vanity storage space, and an extractor fan, providing all the modern amenities required. This apartment offers an ideal blend of modern living, a convenient location, and access to all the amenities Bolton town centre has to offer, making it an excellent choice for First Time Buyers who wish to live close to Bolton Town Centre, or btl investors seeking a low-maintenance, income-generating property with existing tenants in place. Fitted with bespoke shelving and a built-in desk, itâ€™s ideal for remote working, student study, or simply enjoying a moment of calm with a good book. The Heart of the Home The rear of the property opens up into a stunning open-plan kitchen and family dining area. Modern grey woodgrain shaker-style units pair seamlessly with Corian worktops and a statement central island, complete with seating for four, an integrated wine cooler, induction hob, and overhead stainless steel ceiling-mounted extractor. Whether you're hosting drinks, helping with homework, or rustling up dinner, this space brings everyone together. A cookbook shelf and clever storage keep the aesthetic clean and curated, while two integrated Neff ovens, a fridge, freezer, and dishwasher cater to busy family life. A touchless sink tap, metallic mosaic splashback, and diagonally laid wood-effect tiles add stylish, contemporary flair. Sliding patio doors draw the eye toward the landscaped garden, filling the kitchen with natural light and linking indoor comfort with outdoor calm. Off the kitchen, a large utility room offers plumbing for a washing machine and tumble dryer, space for a freestanding fridge-freezer, additional cupboards, and side access â€” keeping life organised and laundry out of sight. Five Double Bedrooms Upstairs, the airy landing leads to five generous bedrooms â€” each tastefully decorated and ready to move straight into. The main bedroom, looking out to the front, features bespoke fitted wardrobes with sliding frosted and mirrored doors and a feature wall in Morris & Coâ€™s wallpaper in soft sage. Its en suite bathroom is a contemporary haven, with marble-style tiling, a walk-in shower with black fixtures, back-to-wall WC, gloss blue wall-hung vanity unit, illuminated mirror, and a sleek black heated towel rail. Bedroom two, overlooking the rear garden, is neutrally decorated with stylish panel detailing and built-in wardrobes â€” ideal for teens or guests. Bedroom three mirrors the chic panelling style of bedroom two and enjoys peaceful views over the rear garden. Bedroom four is neutrally decorated and features fitted wardrobes, making it a bright and versatile space for guests, children, or a dedicated dressing room. Bedroom five, currently set up as a second home office, features a bold teal accent wall and offers plenty of flexibility â€” equally ideal as a creative studio, a cosy bedroom, or a quiet retreat. Stylish Family Bathroom Serving the remaining bedrooms is a luxurious four-piece family bathroom. A gloss white vanity unit, back-to-wall WC, glazed shower enclosure, and a jacuzzi bath with chrome fixtures provide all the essentials â€” while the feature three-tone grey tiling and chrome heated towel rail offer a touch of spa-like luxury. A Private Outdoor Escape The beautifully landscaped rear garden is a true private haven, framed by mature trees and lush hedging that offer both seclusion and tranquillity. A sweeping curved Indian stone patio runs the full width of the home, flowing effortlessly up to a raised decked area beneath a charming gazebo â€“ complete with lighting and space for an outdoor heater for year-round enjoyment. To the rear, thereâ€™s a designated space primed for an outdoor kitchen, with built-in units and bench seating perfect for a BBQ or even a pizza oven setup. Whether youâ€™re hosting summer soirÃ©es or enjoying a quiet morning coffee, this space is designed for al fresco living. A step down leads to a neatly kept lawn â€“ ideal for children to play or simply to relax and unwind in peace. An Address to Aspire To Tucked off Chorley New Road, one of Bolton's main arterial routes, discover the tranquil and private haven of No. 4 Oak Coppice. Enjoy the serenity of this exquisite property while benefiting from convenient commuter links right at your doorstep. With rapid access to the M61 and M60 orbital routes, as well as local rail connectionsâ€”including the Scotland-to-Euston line passing through Bolton and links to Manchester Airportâ€”this home offers superb connectivity to nearby cities. The Middlebrook Retail Park, just minutes away by car, provides all your essentials, from supermarkets and cinemas to restaurants and a bowling alley. For a more extensive shopping and dining experience, Bolton city centre is also close by, offering a vibrant mix of shops, cafes, museums, and amenities. Families will appreciate the prime location for education, with the prestigious Bolton School only a short walk away, and other quality schools in the vicinity. For dining options, The Retreat, a popular local restaurant, is just a short stroll from the property. Alternatively, the cosmopolitan city of Manchester, with its diverse culinary scene, is a mere 12-minute drive away, outside of rush hour. This spacious, high-quality family home is offered in excellent condition throughout and ready for its next chapter. With a modern interior, ample double loft space for storage or potential conversion, and the possibility to extend to the side or rear (subject to planning permission), 4 Oak Coppice offers flexibility for growing families. If youâ€™re seeking a peaceful location, elegant living space and a garden to entertain in, this home ticks all the boxes. Finer Details: There is a private drainage system for the development. The property is Freehold. Oak Coppice is a privately managed gated development with its own drainage system and shared communal responsibilities. Residents contribute Â£175 per quarter toward maintenance of shared areas, including the road, electric gates, and street lighting. In addition, there is a Â£400 annual contribution to a communal sinking fund to cover long-term upkeep. The development is overseen by the Oak Coppice Residents Association, in which each homeowner holds an equal share. The roles of Director and Secretary are held by residents and are rotated annually. An Annual General Meeting takes place each December to ensure collaborative and transparent management. This large four bedroom detached property measuring over 2,200 sqft is found on Tandlewood Park - one of the area's best regarded and most sought-after roads, just a short stroll from Tandle Hills, and being home to some of the area's most beautiful properties. EPC - tbc no chain! Could this be your forever family home ? This large four bedroom detached property is found on Tandlewood Park - one of the area's best regarded and most sought-after roads, just a short stroll from Tandle Hills, and being home to some of the area's most beautiful properties. This has been a much cherished and well-loved family home. The property does require refurbishment and modernisation but offers amazing potential for those looking for a property they can improve and add value to. There is over 2,200 sq.ft. Of accommodation which currently comprises porch, large lounge open to kitchen, handy utility room, dining room, good sized downstairs bedroom, and downstairs WC. Upstairs are three further good sized double bedrooms (one with en-suite, and balcony overlooking the rear garden), plus family bathroom. Occupying a generous plot, there are large mature gardens and driveway leading to an attached garage over 28ft in length. Tandlewood Park runs between Tandle Hill Road and Oozewood Road in one of the area's best regarded locations, situated approximately halfway between the towns of Oldham and Rochdale. Whilst the property is just a short drive from the M60/M62 and just over 8 miles from Manchester city centre, it is on the doorstep of the magnificent Tandle Hill Country Park and beautiful local countryside. Royton town centre is around a mile away and has a good range of shops, amenities, bars, cafes and restaurants. title: 4 bed detached house for sale Braemar Lane, Worsley M28
description: Detached Property Four Bedrooms Two Reception Rooms Garage & Driveway Parking Beautiful Private Rear Garden No Onward Chain Excellent Location Peaceful Cul-De-Sac Position Many Local Amenities Close By Excellent Transport Links Millbrooke are delighted to offer for sale this fabulous detached property in the sought after location of Braemar Lane, Worsley. Occupying an enviable position on this peaceful cul-de-sac with the additional benefit of no onward chain, we are expecting plenty of interest for this well-maintained, family home. Internally the property benefits from; a welcoming entrance hall with convenient storage cupboards, a spacious, double aspect lounge with gas feature fireplace and access to the beautiful rear garden, a generous sized dining room and a fabulous fitted kitchen which was last updated just over five years ago. The kitchen provides both access to the garden and to a large integral garage. The first floor offers four fabulous sized bedrooms, the master boasting fitted wardrobes and the second double bedroom offering useful storage cupboards. There is also a family bathroom and separate W/C. Externally there is a wonderful, private rear garden, beautifully landscaped to include mature shrubs and trees and with scope to extend the living accommodation if desired. A patio area offers further opportunity to relax or entertain during the summer months and enjoy al fresco dining in beautiful surroundings. To the front there is a lawned garden and a spacious driveway, leading up to an integral garage, offering ample and secure off road parking. The location of this charming home is within easy access to the many local shops and amenities Boothstown has to offer and is well placed for highly renowned schooling. It is also ideal for access to major transport links making it ideal for those looking to commute into Manchester city centre, Salford Quays and across the North West. The idyllic location and abundance of versatility this property offers, creates the perfect family home. Rarely do homes of this type remain on the market for long and as such, an early internal viewing is strongly advised to avoid disappointment and to truly appreciate the wealth of space this property has to offer. title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale Cambell Road, Winton M30
description: Beautifully Presented Throughout Open Plan Kitchen, Living and Dining Space Three Bedrooms, Master with Fitted Wardrobes Stunning Four Piece Family Bathroom Suite Installed Three Years Ago Low Maintenance Garden to the Rear with Artificial Lawn Off Road Parking for Multiple Cras and Detached Garage with Power Within Catchment for Highly Sought After Schooling Located between both Monton & Worsley Villages Surrounded by Excellent Amenities & Transport Links This beautifully presented three bedroom semi-detached house offering a blend of modern and practical living in a sought-after location. Situated between the charming Monton and historic Worsley villages, this property promises convenience for the future buyers. As you step through the front door, the entrance hallway leads you through to the open plan living space that occupies the ground floor, flooding the room with natural light through the French doors and Bay window. Heading to the first floor you will find the three bedrooms, the master featuring fitted wardrobes. The stunning four-piece family bathroom suite, installed just three years ago, adds a touch of luxury and completes the first floor. To the rear of the property, you will discover a low maintenance garden with artificial lawn, ideal for enjoying the outdoors without the need for extensive upkeep. For those with multiple vehicles or in need of additional storage space, the off-road parking area and detached garage with power supply offer both convenience and practicality. With highly sought-after schooling positioned at the top of the road this house falls perfectly within the catchment area for both St Gilberts and St Patricks. The property is surrounded by excellent amenities and transport links, and is sure to attract a variety of potential buyers. EPC Rating: D Location Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus. title: 3 bed detached bungalow for sale Foxholes Road, Horwich, Bolton BL6
description: High quality address Train links around 2 miles Fantastic access to open countryside Horwich centre under 1 mile Motorway link around 3 miles Generous plot with West facing rear garden Living space positioned to the rear Three bedrooms plus large shower room No chain Likely to have potential for extension Owned within the same family for many years and now available with no chain is this three bedroom and two living room detached true bungalow. Foxholes Road is one of the towns leading residential roads and plays host to a good number of individual properties. The West side of the road benefits from well orientated rear gardens in terms of afternoon and evening sun. The layout includes a porch and generous hallway providing a sense of space and the two living areas are positioned to the rear the lead reception room having a featured vaulted ceiling. The kitchen is adjacent to the second living area. The three bedrooms are served by a large shower room (fitted in 2024) and there is also a separate WC, utility room and tandem style integral garage. You may note by investigating other homes on the road that there have been many properties adapted and extended which may be possible with this property also. The properties along this road often generate speedy rates of sale and so an early viewing should be considered essential. The sellers inform us that the property is Freehold. Council Tax is Band F - Â£3,318.18 Foxholes Road is one of the town's most prestigious addresses. The lovely semi-rural setting allows the property to enjoy easy access to the surrounding countryside which is literally on the doorstep, whilst important amenities and transport links are conveniently positioned. Horwich itself offers a choice of nurseries and there are both primary and secondary schools. Please note that that Bolton School is around is around 4.5 miles away and the bus route for the school passes the end of the road (on Chorley Old Road). In terms of commercial amenities, Horwich centre itself is under 1 mile away. The popular centre includes free parking and a classic range of shops, such as butchers, bakers, green grocers, some small supermarkets and an abundance of cafes and restaurants. Larger retail outlets are positioned at the Middlebrook retail complex close to the motorway link which is just under three miles away. The closest train stations which connect to Manchester are between 2 and 3 miles. Finally, and as mentioned previously, the surrounding countryside is a very strong feature. Paths lead immediately from the road into the hills which include a stretch of the West Pennine Moors. This area links to The Smithills Estate, an area that has recently been acquired by The Woodland Trust. Porch 4' 10" x 7' 9" (1.47m x 2.36m) Access into the first part of the hallway. title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale Whitley Crescent, Whitley, Wigan WN1
description: Immaculate Semi Detached House Highly Desirable Location Extended to provide 1392 Sq Ft of Accommodation Three Bedrooms Beautiful Gardens and Extended Driveway Close to Wigan Town Centre & The Stunning Haigh Hall Estate Tracy Phillips Estates is delighted to present this charming 1930s semi-detached home, located on one of the Whitleyâ€™s most desirable roads. Set in a slightly elevated picturesque position, High Heathwaite offers a perfect blend of timeless character and modern living, with tasteful extensions and stylish interior features throughout. The rear garden is a true highlightâ€”beautifully maintained and ideal for relaxing or entertaining. Inside, the home boasts excellent space with modern additions, carefully curated by our current owners. Offering approximately 1391 square feet of accommodation, the traditional home briefly comprises a glazed entrance porch leading into the attractive hallway. A returning staircase leads to the first floor, with parquet flooring and a pretty leaded window retained from the original home. To the front of the property is the first reception room, currently used as a dining room, features a walk-in bay window and a central fireplace whilst the second reception space is utilised as the family living room featuring a newly fitted modern feature wall. This room has been vastly enhanced by a large extension, which is filled with light from vast Bi folding doors and Velux roof lights and has space for both informal dining and an additional seating area and wraps around the property to lead into the modern fitted kitchen area. Complete with neutral modern units and including integrated appliances the kitchen space compliments the open plan rear ground floor. Feature mood lighting is a lovely addition. The clients have also quite cleverly created a super utility space, ideal for the laundry and providing excellent further storage, which includes a handy ground floor cloakroom. This area allows access to the side of the property from front to back and allows access in to both the garden and garage. The first floor of the property includes three excellent and spacious bedrooms and a smart family bathroom complete with vanity wash hand basin, separate shower and freestanding bath and with a separate w.c. The outside spaces compliment the interior of this home with style. The widened driveway has been beautifully finished with a red brick wall, flagged driveway and exterior lights edged by manicured lawns and rockery. The rear garden is stunning. Beautiful lawns, mature plating producing a riot of colour, two flagged patio areas are ideal for outdoor dining whatever the time of day. The garden is well screened and secure and also accesses a detached brick-built garage, perfect for larger item storage. Situated on the edge of the sought-after Whitley area, the property enjoys close proximity to Wigan town centre, the stunning Haigh Country Estate with over 250 acres of woodland and rural walks, Mesnes Park, and a wide range of local amenities. It is also conveniently located near excellent schools and major transport links including the M6 and M61, offering the perfect balance of peaceful living with superb connectivity. This fabulous semi-detached family home located on the ever popular Simpson Road, Worsley, boasts heaps of flexible living space and four great sized bedrooms. The property is ideally located close to Boothstownâ€™s wealth of amenities including cafes, restaurants and bars. It is in close proximity to the Bridgewater Canal. For those with children of school age, this property is within walking distance of St Andrews Primary School. The property comprises, a welcoming and generous entrance hallway, spacious open plan lounge/diner with dual aspect windows. The recently fitted, modern and stylish kitchen is located to the rear elevation with access to the garden and driveway. A guest w/c completes the ground floor accommodation. Stairs leading to the first floor open onto a good sized landing area where you will find three large double bedrooms and an ample sized single bedroom. Externally, the property occupies a large corner plot with lawns and mature shrubbery borders. There is a lovely private garden to the rear which can be accessed to the side of the property offering ample off road parking for several vehicles and a useful storage shed to the side elevation. This property is perfect for young families as its just a short walk to two excellent primary schools as well as a local park with a bowling green, tennis court and sports court. The Bridgewater canal is also just a short stroll away for family walks. There are excellent commuter links via car and bus with the M60 Ring Road and the A580 East Lancashire Road on the doorstep. Early viewing of this wonderful home is highly recommended to avoid disappointment. title: 6 bed detached house for sale Baldingstone, Bury BL9
description: Magnificent period country property Grade II listed and set in grounds of c 3 acres Beautifully appointed throughout Separate two bedroom guest cottage in the grounds Six bedrooms in the main house plus four recption rooms Tucked away position yet with easy access to motorway system Formal gardens, gravel driveway, expansive patio areas plus tennis court Highly adaptable accommodation All mains services A quite exceptional Grade II detached period residence, thought to date from around1604 and occupying a tucked away position in Walmersley, Bury just a short drive from the nearest motorway junction and within 2 miles of Bury town centre. Accessed from Walmersley Old Road down a short lane and then through remotely operated entrance gates onto the gravel driveway with turning point and central fountain, the main house, separate two bedroom cottage, outbuildings, tennis court and formal gardens amount to around 3 acres in total. Throughout the property's history there have been several extensions and alterations and the recent custodians have been very careful to retain the original character of this family home in any improvements they have made. The facade is quite spectacular with mullioned windows, stone guttering and stone slab roof, but it is the sheer size and presentation of the accommodation on offer that will most certainly impress. Altogether there is close to 7000 square feet of accommodation on offer! The main house has six bedrooms, four reception rooms, three bathrooms plus guest cloakroom, period dining kitchen, conservatory all with original period features, most with fireplaces and beamed ceilings. The separate cottage, accessed via a side driveway, has independent heating and offers a modern kitchen and bathroom, two double bedrooms and first floor lounge. There are workshops and garages together with a tarmac tennis court and formal gardens, grounds and patio areas in total of c3 acres. Tenure - Freehold EPC - Exempt Council Tax Banding - Main House - H Council Tax Banding - Guest Cottage - B Reception Hall Grand reception hall with parquet flooring and stone fireplace with woodburning stove, mullioned windows, beamed ceiling and open spindled staircase to the first floor landing. Drawing Room Stone fireplace with contemporary style log effect gas fire, parquet flooring, mullioned windows to front and side. Dining Room Impressive dining room with mullion window to the front, recessed stone fireplace and parquet flooring. Kitchen Sympathetically improved over recent years with a range of oak fitted units and cabinetry, granite worktops and ceramic sinks. Gas powered Aga, tiled flooring and sash windows overlooking the rear patio. Access to rear lobby housing the gas central heating boiler. Preparation Room With direct access to the kitchen and dining room. Sitting Room Palatial room with mullion window and beamed ceiling. Access to the conservatory. Conservatory Beautiful glazed conservatory with French doors leading onto the rear patio area Inner Hall Parquet flooring and access to the guest W.C. First Floor Galleried Landing With parquet flooring and mullion window to the front. Steps up to a further landing area with stained glass skylight. Principal Bedroom Range of contemporary wardrobes in light oak. Gas powered stove fire in stone fireplace. Mullion window overlooking the gardens, access to ensuite shower room. Bedroom Mullion window to the front, ornamental stone fireplace. Bedroom Window to the side and rear. Main Bathroom Three piece suite with twin wash hand basins, w.c. And panelled bath with thermostatic shower over. Window to the rear. Bedroom With window to the rear. Bedroom With stone fireplace and mullion window to the front. Bathroom Three piece suite with corner bath, twin wash hand basins and corner shower cubicle with thermostatic shower. Window to the rear. Separate W.C. Outside The property is approached via 'Baldingstone' a single track lane off Walmersley Old Road serving four of five other homes. The remotely operated entrance gates lead onto a gravel driveway and up to the front of the main house with a turning circle and central fountain. There are formal gardens, lawns, wooded areas, patios and tennis court, in all amounting to c3 acres. The Guest Cottage The guest cottage provide two double bedroom accommodation, contemporary kitchen and bathroom fittings and a first floor lounge area with patio doors leading onto a rear stone patio area. The cottage is accessed via a separate driveway from the main house and is self contained. Outbuildings & Garaging The property has useable garaging for 3 cars and several workshop areas for garden machinery and storage. The Tennis Court Will require resurfacing but in the perfect position away from the property. title: 4 bed detached house for sale Templecombe Drive, Bolton, Greater Manchester BL1
description: ***four bedroom detached***situated on the desirable templecombe dirve***modernised to A high standard throughout*** Situated on the ever-desirable Templecombe Drive, this spacious 4-bedroom detached home offers versatile living spaces and modern conveniences, perfect for family life. Upon entering, you're welcomed by a large entrance hall leading to the rest of the house. The main living room, the family hub, features fronted windows and French doors that open out to the rear garden, creating a seamless flow between indoor and outdoor living. The dining room, equally versatile, can serve as a family dining area or a playroom, complete with sliding patio doors to the garden. For those who enjoy entertaining, the double doors between the living and dining rooms can be opened to create an expansive, open-plan layout. The recently modernised kitchen boasts a range of integrated appliances and adjoins a useful utility room, offering additional convenience. At the front of the property, a large sitting area has been cleverly divided into an office and a separate sitting room, but could also be adapted as a games room, providing a truly flexible space. A modern downstairs WC and a handy storage closet complete the ground floor. Upstairs, the property features four bedrooms and a stylish family bathroom. The master bedroom is a generous double with fitted wardrobes and an elegant ensuite shower room. The second and third bedrooms are also comfortable doubles, both with fitted wardrobes, while the fourth bedroom is perfect as a single or home office, featuring fitted wardrobes and overhead storage. Externally, the property offers two driveways, one at the front and another at the rear, along with a garage. The rear garden has been thoughtfully designed for low maintenance, with a blend of decking and lawn, making it an ideal space for relaxation or family gatherings. This property is a must-see for families seeking a flexible, modern home in a highly sought-after location. description: 19th Century Character Property Boasting Over 2500sqft Of Living Accommodation Three Double Bedrooms Main With En-Suite & Dressing Room Two Further Bathrooms Large Games Room With Bar Area Landscaped Gardens Ample Off-Road Parking Private Road Access No Chain Tucked away at the end of a private lane, this enchanting 19th century residence forms part of a peaceful hamlet of just three properties, the home enjoys complete seclusion and serenity, making it perfect for those seeking a retreat from the hustle and bustle of modern life. Rich in period detail and character, the property offers over 2,500sqft of versatile living accommodation, sympathetically maintained and thoughtfully arranged for modern living. A showstopper from the outside, the home is beautifully draped in mature wisteria throughout the spring and summer months, adding to its already captivating curb appeal. The ground floor features a welcoming entrance hall that leads into a spacious and cosy lounge with original features and views over the front and rear gardens. A bright and well-appointed breakfast kitchen provides the heart of the home, ideal for everyday family life. Additional spaces on the ground floor include a practical utility room, a downstairs bathroom, and a bespoke bar and games roomâ€”perfect for hosting friends or enjoying relaxed evenings in. Upstairs, a generous landing with a dedicated study area leads to three well-proportioned double bedrooms and a stylish family bathroom. The main bedroom is a true retreat, complete with its own en-suite and a large dressing area, offering comfort and privacy in equal measure. Externally, the home sits within landscaped grounds, with a lawned front garden and ample off-road parking located at the foot of the plot. The rear garden is both spacious and low-maintenance, arranged over tiers to provide a variety of usable outdoor spaces, all surrounded by mature trees and planting for complete privacy. This home perfectly blends quiet living with convenience, located within easy reach of local amenities, schools, and transport links including the train station and motorway network, while benefiting from the peace and quiet of its unique hamlet setting. The lounge seamlessly flows into the dining space and on through to the conservatory that overlooks the well kept rear garden. Adjacent to the dining room is the impressive 18ft extended kitchen, flooded with natural light and offers a range of wall and base units providing excellent storage and work surface space. Heading to the first floor, the spacious landing leads through to the three generously sized bedrooms which are complemented by the three piece bathroom suite that benefits from a shower sat above the corner tub. The property is perfectly located within the catchment area of highly sought-after primary and secondary schooling, making it a perfect choice for families with children. Additionally, the off-road parking and well-kept gardens to the front and rear of the property add convenience to this already impressive property. Surrounded by excellent amenities and transport links, this property offers both comfort and convenience. Whether you are looking for proximity to schools, hospitals, or shopping centres, this home has it all. EPC Rating: D Location Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus. description: Rear garden with potential to add off road parking Sizeable reception room plus open plan dining kitchen to the rear Third bedroom is larger than many homes of this design Modern and neutral presentation Well placed for access into the shops and services of Horwich centre Just over one mile to train station connecting to Manchester Representing good value for money Town is nestled at the foot of West Pennine Moors Access to both primary and secondary schools A three-bedroom semidetached home of relatively modern construction and offering good value for money in the current market. It is important to note that there has historically been a driveway to the rear together with the garden area although more recently our clients have opted to use the outside space purely as a garden. The ability to create off road parking is an important and increasingly in demand feature. The generous layout includes a porch projection to the front which is ideal for storing outdoor coats and shoes etc and the lounge is configured with an open plan staircase which increases the sense of size, space and light. To the rear there is a modern dining kitchen which overlooks and opens to the rear garden and to the first floor there are three bedrooms two of which are a good double size. Please note that the third bedroom is larger than a typical box room. The modern shower room is positioned to the rear and there is also potential for storage within the loft. We feel the property would suit first time buyers, those downsizing from a larger property and buy to let investors. The convenient location will no doubt suit those buyers looking for easy access to the popular shops and services within the nearby town centre. The property is Freehold Council Tax is Band B - Â£1,786.72 Horwich is a popular town which is very well-connected in terms of transport infrastructure. This particular home has access to a mainline train station in just over 1 mile, whilst Junction 6 of the M61 is around 3 miles away. Horwich Centre itself is close to hand and includes an abundance of largely independently owned shops and services, pubs and restaurants together with smaller express style supermarkets. Additionally, around 3 miles away, there is access to an out-of-town style retail development which in addition to the usual commercial facilities includes the likes of a cinema, bowling alley and large restaurants etc. The countryside is also a very strong feature of the town and access is provided into a stretch of the West Pennine Moors and the Rivington Country Park. A simple glimpse at a satellite image will display the vast quantity of open green space which is easily accessible from the home. description: Easy reach of Lostock train station & M61 motorway providing access to the Manchester commuter links Outstanding rated Lostock Primary School under one mile Bolton school around 2 miles Pleasant, private landscaped garden with natural stream and overlooking woodland Modern kitchen and bathroom Open plan living Neutral dÃ©cor throughout Bedrooms one and two particularly large Double garage Prime and sought after location 3 Holly Dene Drive is a most impressive home offering flexible accommodation and finished in a modern and neutral manner. A particularly strong characteristic is the setting itself which is a low density cul de sac with properties located on just one side of the road, meaning that the subject property enjoys an open aspect to both the front and rear. This characteristic is seldom associated with the immediate area. The rear garden has been thoughtfully landscaped and boasts a lower-level patio sitting alongside a natural stream and overlooking woodland. The big ticket items such as kitchen and bathroom have been thoughtfully modernised and the flexible accommodation includes an open plan kitchen and living area, separate study/playroom and a substantial main reception room. To the first floor there are 4 bedrooms, numbers 1 and 2 are particularly well proportioned. The master bedroom includes an en suite with the further 3 bedrooms being served by the main family bathroom. There are further family-friendly characteristics such as a large integral double garage, separate utility, ground floor WC and there is excellent potential to extend above the garage area should larger first floor accommodation be needed in due course. The two junctions of the M61 are also well placed and around 2.5 miles away. The nearest commercial centre is the Middlebrook Leisure and Retail Complex and also Horwich town centre. description: Fantastic Three/Four Bedroom Semi-Detached Property Located in the Popular Astley Area, Within Easy Access of Tyldesley Town Centre Well-Presented Lounge and a Modern Kitchen Diner with Patio Doors to the Rear Previously Four Bedrooms with the Potential to Convert Back, One Bedroom was Previously Split into Two Modern Three-Piece Family Bathroom Large Main Bedroom with an Ensuite Driveway and a Garage to the Side for Off-Road Parking and Storage Beautifully Presented Garden to the Rear with Laid-to-Lawn Grass and Paving, that Benefits from the Sun Close to Excellent Transport Links into Manchester, Warrington and Liverpool Viewing is Highly Recommended! **no vendor chain & a loft conversion! ** Providing an Abundance of Space and a Fantastic Location, this Three/Four Bedroom Semi-Detached Property has a Lot to Offer! There is a low-maintenance garden to the front, and a beautifully presented garden to the rear, with laid-to-lawn grass and paving, that benefits from the sun. The crisp white rendered faÃ§ade, slate-tiled roof, and heritage-style windows are framed by beautifully maintained wraparound gardens, mature borders, and a classic picket fence. A sweeping driveway provides ample off-road parking for up to eight vehicles, with a detached garage discreetly tucked away to the rear. Interior Elegance & Design From the moment you step into the Edwardian-style tiled porch, you'll feel the refined character that runs throughout. A bright and welcoming hallway showcases oak engineered wooden flooring, high ceilings, and traditional features such as deep skirting boards and a panelled staircase â€“ all illuminated by soft natural light. A clever understairs cupboard provides practical storage for coats, boots, and everyday essentials. To the left, the formal lounge offers an elegant retreat with a large bay window adorned with original leaded panes above, paired with white plantation shutters. Warm timber flooring flows underfoot, while two-tone painted walls, picture rails, and a central chimney breast with a mounted TV create a cosy and stylish setting. Sophisticated, Social, and Seamlessly Styled At the heart of the home lies an expansive open-plan kitchen, dining, and family room â€“ a space designed for connection, celebration, and everyday life. Framed by sleek bronze-effect cabinetry, this kitchen is as functional as it is beautiful. A bespoke central island, with a mix of white gloss cupboards with contrasting pale grey granite and textured bronze laminate worktops, forms the centrepiece of the room. Elegant pendant lighting casts a soft, ambient glow, creating the perfect backdrop for both family breakfasts and late-night dinners with friends. Integrated Bosch appliances, including twin ovens and dishwasher, sit within a wall of tall units, accompanied by a striking American-style fridge freezer. The handleless design and matte finishes speak to modern tastes, while the oak flooring grounds the space with warmth and texture. To one side, a casual seating area is gathered around a wood-burning stove, offering a cosy nook for winter evenings. The dining zone, set beneath a vaulted ceiling with Velux window, opens to the rear garden via sleek bi-folding doors, allowing natural light to pour in and creating a fluid connection between indoor and outdoor living. Utility & Ground Floor Luxury A separate utility room houses space and plumbing for a washing machine and dryer, with direct garden access â€“ ideal for airing laundry on summer days. Adjacent, a stylish ground-floor shower room features a contemporary walk-in rainfall shower, WC, slimline vanity unit, and porcelain tiles, all chosen to offer a spa-like finish with day-to-day practicality. First Floor: Space to Grow and Unwind Upstairs, a bright and airy landing â€“ lit by a charming leaded window â€“ leads to four spacious double bedrooms, each presented in a soothing neutral palette with modern laminate flooring. Each room offers ample space for freestanding or fitted wardrobes, allowing for easy customisation to suit your needs. The family bathroom is a luxurious sanctuary, thoughtfully designed for relaxation and indulgence. It features a freestanding bath, a wet-room-style walk-in shower with a traditional rainfall head, a sleek grey gloss vanity unit, a backlit mirror, and striking porcelain marble-effect tiles that stretch from floor to ceiling, creating a sense of timeless elegance. A separate, modern WC is conveniently located next door. Endless Potential Set on a substantial corner plot, 40 Carlton Road offers fantastic scope for future development, subject to the necessary planning approvals. The generous garden provides space for a rear or side extension, while the detached garage presents an excellent opportunity for conversion into a self-contained annex, home office, or studio. Inside, further potential lies in the vast loft, which spans the full footprint of the home. Accessed via a loft hatch, it boasts a high-pitched roof and generous head heightâ€”ideal for conversion. With ample space to accommodate up to three double bedrooms and two bathrooms, this area offers an exciting opportunity to significantly increase the homeâ€™s living space, subject to the relevant consents. Step Outside To the front, a spacious driveway provides off-road parking for multiple vehicles, while a gated side driveway offers additional secure parking leading up to the detached double garage. A generous lawned garden wraps around the side of the property, bordered by mature trees and well-established shrubs, creating a sense of privacy and greenery. From the front, a paved patio extends along the side of the home, seamlessly flowing into a further rear patio area â€“ perfect for outdoor dining, entertaining, or simply relaxing in the sun. Location: Quiet Elegance Meets Everyday Convenience Tucked away on a peaceful, tree-lined stretch of Carlton Road â€“ just off the coveted Greenmount Lane in the heart of Markland Hill â€“ this home offers a rare blend of tranquillity and accessibility. Youâ€™re a short stroll from the prestigious Bolton School, local cricket and tennis clubs, and a selection of quality pubs, restaurants, and leisure amenities. For commuters, Bolton town centre is within easy reach, while the nearby M61 motorway provides quick links to Manchester, Preston, and beyond. In Summary 40 Carlton Road is more than just a house â€“ it's a lifestyle. Intelligently extended, immaculately renovated, and exquisitely styled, this exceptional home ticks every box for the modern family. From the grand proportions to the fine finishes, from the thoughtful layout to the superb location â€“ every element has been designed with comfort, elegance, and lasting value in mind. title: 4 bed detached house for sale Broadhalgh Avenue, Bamford, Rochdale OL11
description: Unique Detached Family Home Four Spacious Bedrooms Principle Suite With En-Suite & Dressing Room Two Reception Rooms Family Bathroom & Two En-Suites Superb Conservatory Breakfast Kitchen With Utility Room Home Office/Study Integral Garage & Ample Off-Road Parking No Chain Peacefully positioned on the private Broadhalgh Avenue, a historic local coaching lane, this fabulous property could be your forever home! Enter through the front door, opening to a light, bright and airy entrance hall with tiled floor extending beneath and giving access to the main lounge, dining room, breakfast kitchen and home office/study. To the rear, the main lounge seamlessly connects to a superb conservatory that overlooks the rear garden. Adjoining to the main lounge, the breakfast kitchen. Light and bright, this kitchen offers an abundance of storage within its many cupboards and drawers, furnished with an array of integrated appliances including a range cooker. Further storage can be found in the utility room. A central island topped with a granite worktop offers an excellent place for everyday eating. From the kitchen, return to the entrance hall to find the dining room, another bright and bountiful space, decorated in neutral tones. Across the hall, a home office/study can be found with fitted storage. Completing the ground floor living accommodation is a downstairs WC. Heading upstairs, and into the principle suite you are first greeted by the main bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a dressing room with ample wardrobe space and four-piece en-suite bathroom. From here, there are three further well-proportioned bedrooms. The second bedroom also boasts fitted wardrobes and an en-suite. The remaining bedrooms are served by a contemporary three-piece bathroom containing a bath, wash hand basin and WC. An accommodating home even from the outside, there is ample space for several cars, in addition to an integral garage with door and pedestrian access to the home via the utility room. The neat & tidy lawns to the front and rear are both extremely well maintained, with a large patio area at the rear providing pockets of sunshine and shade in which to recline and relax. Hedge borders add privacy to the already private gardens which back onto an open aspect. The property is situated within walking distance of both Bamford and Oulder Hill shopping precincts and local primary & secondary schools certified 'excellent' by Ofsted, the dwelling is located close to the Rochdale to Bury main road making it convenient for both town centres, Manchester City centre and motorway network. description: The Perfect Family Home, Located on a Desirable Development Close to Excellent Amenities Family Lounge, Impressive 22ft Conservatory, Study and Snug High Specification Fitted Kitchen with Quartz Work Surfaces Four Double Bedrooms, One Currently Used as a Walk in Wardrobe Three Piece Family Bathroom, En Suite & Guest W.C. Private, Low Maintenance Rear Garden with Composite Decking & Artificial Lawn Off Road Parking for Multiple Vehicles Immaculately Presented to a High Standard Throughout Well Served by Public Transport & Motorway Links Offered to the Market with No Onward Chain Welcome to this incredible four bedroom detached house, the epitome of the perfect family home. Located on a desirable development close to excellent amenities, this property offers a blend of comfort and luxury that is sure to impress. Situated in an area well-served by public transport and motorway links, convenience is at your doorstep. Stepping through the entrance door on to the engineered solid oak flooring, you are greeted by the inviting hallway that leads through to the study and the snug which was previously the garage and could easily be converted back. The spacious family lounge sits just down the hallway which seamlessly flows on to the impressive 22ft conservatory, that overlooks the beautiful low maintenance rear garden, and opens up on to the high specification fitted kitchen and dining space complete with quartz worksurfaces. Completing the ground floor of this lovely home is the guest w.c. This incredible property features four double bedrooms, each offering ample space. One of the bedrooms is currently used as a walk in wardrobed, providing a touch of luxury to the master bedroom. The three-piece family bathroom, en suite, and guest W.C. The private, low maintenance rear garden is a peaceful retreat, complete with composite decking and artificial lawn - perfect for outdoor gatherings. The property is immaculately presented to a high standard throughout, ensuring a turn key experience for the new owners. EPC Rating: C Location Famous for its steel manufacture, Irlam, which neighbours both Eccles & Cadishead and is easily commutable via the A57 and is also served by Irlam train station and local bus services. There are excellent local shops including Tesco Express, a Lidl supermarket and more family run businesses. The area benefits from Irlam leisure centre offering swimming, gym & exercise classes daily, Princes park and Chats Moss. There are both Good and Outstanding schools in the area for both primary & secondary aged children, alongside childcare settings for pre schoolers. Irlam is located just a short drive to both Warrington Town Centre via Manchester Road, and the Trafford Centre via Liverpool Road; which leads the M60 motorway junction.
